name: Max’s Allegheny Tavern
highlights: The exception is the bar area that's good for happy hour or watching a game, or just having a beer -- that has a lot of neon and a jukebox.
We had the Reuben on potato pancakes with kase spatzle (spatzle noodles in a creamy Gouda cheese sauce) -- amazing!
The schitzel is good but not great but overall way better than Hofbrauhaus and not Disney- it's the real McCoy.

name: Leon’s Caribbean Restaurant
highlights: I got the jerk lunch with beans rice and cabbage and everything was just delicious .
Great Jerk chicken comparable to the spots I ate in Jamaica (I ate it 7 days in a row on vacation).
This restaurant is a whole in the wall good for take out caribbean/Jamaican food.

name: James Street Gastropub & Speakeasy
highlights: The happy hour here is good- the last time I went I had a Vesper martini (I love Casino Royale, don't judge me!).
This visit we had 4 cocktails, the pipe bombs as an appetizer, and entrees of crabcakes and fish/chips.
Then again, I seriously doubt one can prepare one's self for the indulgence of the Sweet Meat Burger.

name: The Zenith
highlights: As someone skeptical of Vegan food, this place more than exceeded my expectations.
Went here for brunch with my father for fathers day, he's totally a meat eater, but he's open minded sometimes.
If you can locate this place in Southside it takes even more searching to find someone to seat you in the backside if the antique store.

name: Tana Ethiopian Cuisine
highlights: *gluten free injera available if you call 3 days in advance* Food was great.
The injera, tana tibs, beet salad, sambusa, and fossolia were flavorful and well portioned.
If you find yourself waiting for a table at the ever-crowded Abay-- or better yet, before you even go!

name: Craftwork Kitchen
highlights: I think at one point I was eating breakfast and lunch at Craftwork two to three times a week.
However, when I got back to my desk and had my Porkgasm--er, ate my Porkgasm sandwich--I was more than okay with trading volume for quality.
Luckily, Craft Work is one of two options (the other being Istanbul grille) that satiate the hungry without having to eat overpriced chain fast food.
address:
600 Grant St
USX Tower
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Primanti Bros
highlights: Beers were relatively cheap and there was plenty of parking around the restaurant.
I've only been once but I got one of the well-known pastrami sandwiches loaded with fries and cole slaw.
I had to try the Pitts-burger which is their burger with cole slaw and french fries added.

name: Primanti Bros.
highlights: Also, parking in the area is tough, but we totally lucked out and got a spot right by Primanti Brothers that is reserved for customers and was free!
Their deli 'sammiches' hit the spot, piled high on thick cut Italian bread with cole slaw and fresh cut French fries.
Every time I come back from a trip and drive through the fort Pitt tunnels all I can think about is primanti bros

name: Piper’s Pub
highlights: They have a happy hour special from 5-7 $2 off any draft (they have tons of beer here).
Saturdays, they have special boxty and you'll often see Monday lunch specials using boxty, like a pulled pork boxty.
I so badly want to try this breakfast staple and maybe catch a football game (aka soccer to us Yanks) .

name: South Side BBQ Company
highlights: So, why would a vegetarian go to southside BBQ, well initially, I went for the people.
I especially love spicy food, and sometimes their ghost pepper macaroni and cheese is what is needed to totally satisfy the craving!
Had to try their unique version of an ice cream cone called Barbacone.

name: Peanut Butter Jelly Time
highlights: Prices are good and atmosphere is friendly, it's worth a try for a unique experience.
This concept is awesome.
Tasty sandwiches, nice selection, good value, good service, liked the Elvis and the Red Raz Roll.

name: Cafe Sam
highlights: They typically went for lunch and not dinner but the dinner menu sounded good too so we had to try it!
There is a piano at the bar, and a mannequin sitting there you'd swear was real until you looked with a startled grin.
I go their every time I'm in Pittsburgh doing hospital stuff since its about 10 minutes away from UPMC.

name: Squirrel Hill Cafe
highlights: The food is really good (always got on the burgers side), the beer cheap, the waitresses nice.
I don't think we would eat at the cafe simply because it is a smoking establishment and we don't smoke...but for take out - YES!
Every booth and table is an exhibit or cage at a zoo, there for you to observe how each group interacts with one another.

name: E Town Bar and Grille
highlights: had one of the best lunches ever for take out yesterday....keep up the good work,burger was awesome and chicken was perfect ,thank you
Ok, I hate to admit because this review might make the wait longer on Fridays, but this is the best fish sandwich I've ever had.
The sandwich comes with two giant fillets, fries, coleslaw and a bun to make a sandwich with.

name: Little Tokyo Bistro
highlights: If you've got open time in the afternoon for a late lunch (between 2:30 and 5), you need to wait until dinner, which is a bit of a bummer.
Their specialty rolls are delicious, as well, but I typically like my sushi simpler.
When in Pittsburgh's South Side and craving sushi most people flock to the corner of 17th and Carson to Nakama.

name: Deluca’s Diner
highlights: The place had certainly died down from the brunch craziness so we were able to be seated immediately.
The environment, the coffee, the service, the pancakes, the amazing breakfast potatoes with bits of semi-burnt crispiness.
The french toast was extremely fluffy and had powdered sugar on it :D Loved the home fries by the way!

name: La Gondola Pizzeria & Restaurant
highlights: He makes his own mozzarella cheese and grates it fresh for each order   He has a secret menu of low carb, carb free and gluten free items.
"Like that guy, he's pretty damn good, I'll tell you what," Sergio proclaimed while halfway air-guitaring as Lindsey Buckingham performed a solo.
Its in a great location amd has 4 tables of outdoor seating.

name: Rose Tea Cafe
highlights: We usually parked in a lot behind Dunkin Donuts, which cost a small fee but I am horrible at parallel parking so it worked for me.
The chunk chicken is a personal favorite, with stir fried bok choy or watercress for veggie, and the kumquat lime juice with pearls, yum!
Just about anything on the menu tastes great and there are even some delicacies like pig intestines for the more adventurous people.

name: Istanbul Grille
highlights: All of their cold sides, by the way, are not only vegetarian, but also vegan if you're looking for that as well.
The items really aren't complicated, they are actually quite simple, but Josh works some magic and makes these ingredients work so well.
Shredded beet salad was great.
address:
339 Sixth Ave
Keystone Cafe
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15215

name: Peppi’s
highlights: Parking is on street but otherwise this place gets no complaints from me.
The cajun fries are sinful (dip them in ranch dressing) & they have a fun assortment of drinks.
This place has some of the best subs in Western PA, especially the delicious and appropriately named Roethlisburger, my favourite!

name: Bangal Kabab House and Restaurant
highlights: The buffet always has naan, plain basmati rice, some kind of biryani, veggie pakoras, and tandoori chicken.
We were driving from Pittsburgh to Akron and after quick yelping decided to go to Bengal Kabab House.
The goat biriyani is a must try, the naan was amazing, so was the malai kofta.

name: Silky’s Pub
highlights: Delicious Sunday brunch and 22 ounce Bloody Mary specials.
They have a few TVs which always is showing the big game and usually has good specials during Penguin and Steeler games.
My friend got a chicken bacon cheddar wrap which was good, and the waffle fries were on point.

name: Love Yogurt
highlights: + There are a couple of actual parking spaces in the mini lot out front.
- Potted plant iced matcha latte: Has a very plant-like/earthy flavor because of the matcha and ice and whipped cream if you know what I mean (or am I just imagining it?).
The products are generally pretty good, but none is more fun that the potted plant tea, which they make to look exactly like a potted plant.

name: Harris Grill
highlights: As far as food, Harris has a selection of 1/2 price apps during happy hour--a good option to soak up some of those cosmos.
Every Tuesday [and for us on Thursdays] come to the Bar and snack on strips and strips of delicious pig dripping in its own greasiness.
Anytime friends come to visit from out of town, they ask if we can please go get some frozen cosmos.

name: The Library
highlights: Happy hour EVERYDAY from 5 - 7 and 9 - 11 with $3 draft, $3 energy bombs, and 1/2 off apps.
From 5-7 you can enjoy appetizers or they may call it "small plates' for HALF OFF from 5-7 & all there amazing selection of brews are $3.35.
the food was absolutely excellent [i had the 'arabian nights' hummus plate and the 'animal farm' sandwich] definitely awesome for mid-range pittsburgh fare.

name: Tootie’s Famous Italian Beef
highlights: Vegetarians need not enter, nothing for you here.
I would never have noticed it were it not for the sign pointing me to "hot Italian beef" on Carson.
They make a Chicago staple that I feel is a welcome companion to our beloved Primanti's in the late night sandwich pantheon.

name: Waffles INCaffeinated
highlights: Regular maple, Bourbon infused maple and Vanilla (real vanilla bean infused inside of the bottle) BONUS: Gluten free waffles!
It was really good - I didn't even need syrup but I did try a little  of the bourbon maple which was not overly bourbon flavored.
The sausage and gravy waffle is mouthwatering as is the Funky Monkey Waffle we shared for dessert.

name: Carson Street Deli & Craft Beer Bar
highlights: Parking is either on street (good luck with that) or just a few blocks down there is a pay lot.
The Dizzy Lizzy, with its curried chicken, dried cranberries, and amazing slaw is my solid go-to, but everything I've tried is fantastic.
You can mix and match beers of your choosing and if you put together a six pack you get $2.00 off each beer.

name: Bella Vista
highlights: Make reservations unless you're going to show up at 4 pm like we did.
All in all, not the best meal I've ever had, but I'd call it a solid spot for a romantic or special occasion.
Beef Wellington (almost always available as a special) for $42 was very good but even so I'm not sure it's worth the money.

name: Rivertowne
highlights: Went in just in time for happy hour and tried the IPA (excellent).
Went here with a group of girlfriends celebrating a bachelorette party, before a Pirates game.
The atmosphere is great, especially on the North Shore, right between PNC Park & Heinz Field.

name: Two Louie’s Market
highlights: There is nowhere to eat inside, BUT there is often street parking available within their block if you aren't in walking distance.
Thursday's are my favorite day of the week because I get to have two Louie's buffalo chicken wraps.
A cute touch: The inclusion of a random mini-candy bar with each bag of grub.

name: Arnold’s Tea
highlights: There is street parking along with a parking lot on a diagonol behind it.
If you only have time to stop in for a cold drink their Lavenade is quite refreshing too!
The pear arugula salad is my go-to.

name: Bea Taco Town
highlights: They have an extensive menu with a wide variety of meat choices, even some exotic choices, and vegetarian options.
I am obsessed with the enchiladas suizas, and have to force myself to order other things.
I almost always get a ranchero burrito with chorizo.

name: Pittsburgh Restaurant Week
address:
700 Arch St
Allegheny Commons W
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15212

name: Emporio: A Meatball Joint
highlights: Classic meatballs to chicken (my favorite), spicy pork, and vegan.
I've tried most of their meatballs and sauce combos and they are always delicious.
A little pricey, but excellent service.

name: Six Penn Kitchen
highlights: We got a mimosa and a peach bellini to drink; both were sweet, crisp, brunch-time refreshment.
The happy hour specials on well drinks, domestics, and wine went through the night - 9-11pm.
Our group of 3 decided to tryout their rooftop dining on a nice sunny summer day.

name: Amazing Cafe
highlights: Also, either start with or save room for the baked goods from Gluten Free Goat.
As someone who is not a vegan or even a vegetarian, I cannot speak highly enough about the quality of food at Amazing Cafe.
I highly recommend the Summer Harvest, tulum tacos, and the peace pizza.
address:
1506 E Carson St
Amazing Yoga
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15203

name: Scoglio’s Green Tree
highlights: Everyone goes out of their way to make sure lunch or dinner is perfect.
The decor has an 80's feel but in a good way.
Spinach, ricotta, prosciutto, and mozzarella are rolled in a carpet of housemade pasta with a Farlenaise sauce.

name: Pastoli’s Pizza, Pasta & Paisans
highlights: They're serving the same great pizza with allergen-friendly and gluten-free options and some menu additions...
Everyone is always so friendly here, the staff is great and being knowledgable on  food allergies which is SO appreciated.
The "pork" is juicy and satisfying and the toasted bun has just the right amount of crunch.

name: Wilson’s Bar-B-Q
highlights: The small plate of ribs is *very* filling for lunch.
The hot sauce is hotter than you might expect...so I recommend you ask for a mix, or just go for the mild.
if you are going to the Mattress Factory - make this your after stop!

name: Hunan Bar
highlights: In the summer, I enjoy coming here during the lunch hours for their smaller lunch items.
Firstly, their sign says "Chinese and Cuban Food" which usually isn't something that I'm going to even give a second glance.
It came with green peppers, scallions (cut in a way such that they absorbed the sauce and had a very pleasant flavor), deliciously sweet black beans, and 'hot spicy' red peppers.

name: Sesame Garden
highlights: The won ton soup is solid and my go to dish is the Hunan beer.
Upon calling they quickly sprung into action and delivered the correct order to us within minutes.
Excellent portions great good and if you'd like be sure to ask for all white meat chicken.

name: Tavern In The Wall
highlights: Easily beats all of these fancy burger joints that are popping up around town (and better priced too!!).
I also order the steak salad and the beet salad, which is chock full of fresh roasted beets!
The soups are outstanding, the specials creative and delicious.

name: Lulu’s Noodles
highlights: Lulu's gets 4 stars from me not for the food, but for the bubble tea!
I recommend the Pad Thai and Singapore Rice Noodle, but my all time favorite is the Pan Fried Noodle with Chicken.
As far as inexpensive Asian food in Oakland goes, Lulu's is at the top of my list.

name: Souper Bowl
highlights: Had the mushroom Swiss burger - seriously one of the best burgers I've had in a LONG time.
It is right across the street from the main entrance to the Consol Energy Center.
It's become a staple for myself and friends before concerts or Pens games.

name: Double Wide Grill
highlights: It's so nice to see so many clearly labeled vegetarian and vegan options on their menu.
The seitan wings are the best that I've ever had, the potato tacos are delicious and the BBQ pulled seitan is soooo good.
If you happen to follow my reviews, you may have noticed that my theme this week is OUTDOOR SEATING!!

name: Groceria Merante
highlights: The fresh sandwiches and amazing, as well all of there homemade soups, salads, and meals like meatballs or ravioli.
What to get: proscuitto, capicola, hot sopressata, mozzarella, lettuce, tomato, and hot fried peppers.
$10 for a whole sandwich (on a whole loaf of bread) or $5 for a half (on a half loaf of bread), these sandwiches should last you the entire day.

name: Aladdin’s Eatery - Pittsburgh-Squirrel Hill
highlights: Though I wasn't looking for the options, the menu is very vegan, vegetarian and gluten free friendly as each page notes what dishes are appropriate for specific types of eaters.
Their hummus and pita is a must for an appetizer, and they boast some of the best falafel I've ever eaten (and I'm a falafel freak).
My favorite things include Aladdin's Chicken Pitza, chicken shistawook roll and the spicy Kafka roll!

name: Michael’s Pizza Bar & Restaurant
highlights: In fact, I have eaten a whole medium pizza in one sitting during the Michael's Pizza Challenge.
We've tried the hockey puck, a fried dough ball covered in sauce and its really good.
Two blocks off Carson street on Sarah, it's off the beaten path and is not a place you're likely to just happen upon.

name: Tazza D’oro Cafe & Espresso Bar
highlights: Vegan apple cinnamon donuts were great but steamed milk on latte was less wonderful than I remember.
Enrico's also has become a hub for other community activities - there a a couple of weekly bike groups that meet here.
My boyfriend ordered the italian cappuccino and said it tasted just like the drinks he would get in Italy over his 2 week visit with family this past summer.

name: Thai Gourmet
highlights: we have only gotten take-out here, but we always get the pad thai (amazing) and the red curry (so great).
The only word of caution I would provide is that the spice level can be a little inconsistent sometimes...unless last just my tolerance.
My favorite dish hands down is the chiang mai mee - I get vegetable and it comes with tons of zucchini and carrots.

name: Rasta House Caribbean Resturant
highlights: We decided this is a once a week lunch spot for us.
Curry goat, brilliant, oxtail, excellent, jerk chicken, brilliant, pork, melts in your mouth and his home Mahr sorrel drink with spices was the best.
The storefront itself is pretty small, so takeout might be the better option, but there is seating for a few people if you want to stay.

name: BFG Café
highlights: Great vegetarian options and great pizza, and the service is fast and surprisingly attentive for how big a place it is.
Had the classic gyro and a side of falafel that was very good.
The owner of this establishment, John, is such a genuine, kind, community-minded guy, you feel great supporting him.

name: Nancy’s East End Diner
highlights: Overall, a solid place for brunch.
My daughter ordered an omelet with home fries, and I chose the grilled havarti and apple sandwich on raisin bread.
The decor and tunes bring back memories of grandma's house, always a plus when stopping for breakfast.

name: Stack’d Burgers & Beer
highlights: The customisable burger menu is pretty cool, as you can literally mix and match anything.
I ordered a double stack, kaiser roll, ketchup, mayo, mustard, pickles, and fried mozzarella cheese sticks.
The chicken tenders had an unusual breading which accompanied with the mango habenero sauce was like a sugary/spicy glaze.

name: Curry on Murray
highlights: I enjoyed my meal at Curry on Murray and will return to try more of the curries and perhaps some Pad Thai.
We're big fans of Bangkok Balcony and were apprehensive about this place but honestly it stood up to the comparison.
I have tried their muscles in coconut sauce, red/green/pumpkin curries and amongst them red curry is my favorite.

name: Madonna’s Mediterranean Cuisine
highlights: I would LOVE to see the owners of Madonna's team up with the Vegan Pittsburgh organization to get "Vegan Friendly" certified and label their vegan menu items.
Their falafel is airy and nuanced, chicken shawarma is savory and well portioned and the kicker for me is the baba ghanoush - never too oily and always perfectly seasoned.
The Loubieh was a great take on green beans and hopefully one that's easy to recreate, cause I'm going to give it a shot.

name: The Great American Grill
address:
3454 Forbes Ave
The Hilton Garden Inn
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15213

name: Round Corner Cantina
highlights: It is small inside and pretty dark, so I recommend either going for happy hour and/or trying to sit outside.
It's got such a cool, hip(ster) feel with nice bartenders and an excellent space.
I love the overall vibe and drink selection and will definitely be back for summer nights on the back patio.

name: The Cheesecake Factory
highlights: The happy hour deals are AMAZING the burger is $5.50 and cannot be beat.
They were tasty and stood up well to being eaten several days later as part of our leftovers.
However, I think their dinner entrees are a bit overpriced and underwhelming, and since the wait times can get long, I wouldn't personally get dinner from here.

name: Benjamins Western Avenue Burger Bar
highlights: Their happy hour deals run until 6:30 and they include half off apps and a different special every day.
The home fries are the way to go because the other sides I've tried (broccoli and cole slaw) aren't that great.
I ordered the cheese board yumm-o which is served with truffle mustard and wine braised onions.

name: Thai Me Up
highlights: I got to other thai places as well but have not found a phad thai I like as much.
I usually order take out for lunch and the big debate between the spicy basil noodles and the z-u noodles.
We brought a bottle of wine with us, which was immediately opened for us ($3 fee for the BYOB).

name: Wiggy’s
highlights: 38 wing sauces was mind explosion - fresh cut fries and everything made to order!
Seems like a lot of take out since they don't serve beer and only have a small TV.
Large size, lots of meat on the wing, Great seasonings, and Value you get so much food for a great price!

name: Roasted Barrelhouse & Eatery
highlights: We tried three different sandwiches - pork with broccoli rabe, meatball, and roast beef with horseradish - and all were very good.
The dipping sauce was the perfect exclamation point to a wonderful dish.
The roast beef sandwich was also great, complete with a side of au jus.

name: Showcase BBQ
highlights: My friend mentioned to me a couple of weeks ago that she'd been wanting to try Showcase, since she works nearby and a coworker often gets lunch there.
I normally get the chicken wings and from time to time I'll get some ribs; either the pork or turkey ribs.
My fiancé got ribs and wings with amazing BBQ beans and candied yams.

name: Atria’s
highlights: The happy hour special was affordable.
We had cup and bowl of crab bisque, lunch and full size chopped salads, and salmon salad.
I visited Atria's on Valentines Day so my experience may have been above average.

name: Wallace’s TapRoom
highlights: She told us about how great their Happy Hours (5-7pm) were great.
In Pittsburg at the new Hotel Indigo.
After Yelp Pittsburgh's Makers and Bakers event, my friends and I decided to stay in the hotel and grab dinner.

name: Primanti Bros.
highlights: I like it, people who came up with the idea of putting French fries into a burger is really genius!
They pile the sandwiches high with meat, cheese, French fries and Cole slaw.
This is truly a Pittsburgh staple and is always at the TOP of my list whenever I come to Pitt.

name: The Mediterranean Grill
highlights: I usually just ordered the mezza, with dolmas or falafel depending on my mood.
I personally love the spinach lentil and red lentil soups, the vegetarian grape leaves (you get like 8 or so, its a good amount), and the hummus.
Don't love: the baba ganouj- it's just got a weird flavor- I prefer Aladdin's baba.

name: Thai Cuisine
highlights: There are not may places that make great pad thai and great red curry, but this place does.
I'm sure I will be back again soon with a bottle of wine (BYOB), and an empty stomach.
Spice level is 1-10 scale, I like about a 7 here and it doesn't make me cry so it's perfect!

name: Texas de Brazil
highlights: You also get a few side items--mashed potatoes, fried banana, and cheesy bread, brought out to your table (included in the overall price).
The lobster bisque is amazing and I can't say that I will ever have a bowl as good as this!
The waiter will also bring fried banana as a palate cleanser and garlic mashed potatoes probably to fill your stomach.
address:
240 W Station Square Dr
Ste D1
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: The Map Room Grill & Bar
highlights: My wife, a vegetarian, regularly orders the black strap seitan and loves it.
They have plenty of great beers on tap, daily specials, homemade desserts, and fantastic servers.
The chicken wings are CRAZY large- almost freakishly so.

name: Habitat Restaurant
highlights: It's also known for it's Holiday brunch buffets, it's special dinners, & it's impeccable service & delicious food.
Habitat is intimately tucked into the 2nd floor of the impressive new Fairmont Hotel in downtown.
I got the mushroom tart with Parmesan cream and my friend got the beets with goat cheese.

name: Kassab’s
highlights: I recommend ordering a mezze sampler, which has all of the classic Lebanese goodies (tabbouleh, falafel, hummus, etc) made to perfection.
I consider Kassab's a definite staple for vegetarians who are looking for a place to eat on the Southside and who enjoy affordable prices.
I had the lamb shank with rice for lunch today as well as the vegetable salad.

name: Tipsy Cow
highlights: I also didn't get food, but her service and their happy hour were fantastic.
They offer several predefined burger options as well as a "build-your-own" option similar to Stack'd.  They also offer several apps, mostly of the fried variety.
Make sure you check into their specials, wing night, sangria night, trivia night...etc as theyre well worth it!

name: Giovanni’s Pizza & Restaurant
highlights: First things first....don't take your kids here late at night looking for some rustic Italian pizza experience...its a pretty rough & tumble locale.
Late night delivery was quick and the pie was great, fresh and hot!
Hoagies are HUGE and normally enough for two meals (dinner & then lunch).

name: Ginza
highlights: $8 at lunch buys you TWO sushi rolls and a salad or soup.
Its BYOB if you are dining in, and the bulk of their business is takeout so there's never a wait for a table.
1.5 / 5 - Spicy Girl Roll: This roll lost much of its crunchiness, especially when compared to the two other spicy rolls.

name: Buford’s Kitchen
highlights: Went to the Buford's on 5th across from the Consol Center on a Sunday at 2pm hoping for brunch food.
We booked an area here, as it was near our hotel  for us to watch the Big Game.
Great food across the menu...from the build your own burger, to the Nutella French toast, to the fried green tomatoes, to the fall off the bone ribs, to the heavenly pulled pork nachos.

name: Bistro Penn
highlights: Yeah, it was Happy Hour and the place was packed, and for good reasons already mentioned: 1/2 off all Belgian drafts.
Sharp Edge has about 5 outposts in the Pittsburgh area, each one differing in terms of menu items, decor, and general atmosphere.
Out of towner looking for a place to hang before a Pirates game.

name: The Red Ring Bar & Grille
highlights: Happy Hour is pretty good with some discount cocktails and drafts and a reduced price menu.
Right on Duquesne's campus and a perfect place to go before a concert or Pens game at the Consol Energy Center.
The menu is simple and traditional and it is certainly a great option when you don't want to  spend money on high priced food and drinks at Consol.

name: Hemingway’s Cafe
highlights: The drinks and food came to only $19 because we were there during one of their three happy hours throughout the day.
Depending on the bartender, the shot pitchers can range from "I'm pretty sure this doesn't have alcohol in it" to "Holy blackout".
Hem's has $5 pitchers and great french fries, a good place for munchies and beer after work (or class...

name: Salim’s Middle Eastern Food Store
highlights: I love his babaganoush and vegetarian stuffed grape leaves.
The gyros are just very clean (a little smaller, if you're not planning on ordering sides and are starving, get two), and fresh tasting.
They have basic middle eastern groceries as well as a few hot dishes and classic desserts such as baklava and cashew fingers.

name: Zarra’s A Taste of Southern Italy
highlights: I ended up here after I had to cancel reservations at Asiago's due to a baseball game and I could not find parking in the North Shore.
The food is amazing; get the house soup: it's basically a matzo ball made out of ricotta.
Johnny, Judy, Donny and Jamie, as well as their entire staff make you feel welcomed and it's truly the best place to relax after a long work week (or work day!).

name: Micro Diner
highlights: Especially after almost joining a pretentious brunch a few doors down, I'm glad we made the diner choice.
The pancakes were delicious and not overly sweat, the potato cakes were fluffy and the eggs were just right.
So yes, Micro Diner isn't exactly macro in terms of innovation, but if you need palatable, old-fashioned, unpretentious grub to grease up your tummy after a wild night of prowling about, here ya are.

name: Gluten Free Goat Bakery
highlights: Always a big fan of supporting local businesses, so I'd highly recommend giving Gluten Free Goat Bakery a try.
It's located in the Pittsburgh public market, which has a ton of hip food places (the nearby pasta shop has lots of vegan options).
They just opened up their brick & mortar  - such nice people!

name: Village Tavern and Trattoria
highlights: 45c wings on Tuesdays and 2 dollar domestics for happy hour
Sunday is jazz day on the patio.
Delicious fresh spinach & tomato pie served by coolest sweetest bartender out under the roof at the patio bar.

name: Joe & Pie
highlights: Other pizza joints should take note.
My boyfriend and I stopped in here for breakfast and it did not disappoint!
Definitely a contender in the Liberty Avenue row, although I'd probably suggest trying the two Middle-Eastern items on the menu rather than their more conventional menu items.

name: The Livermore
highlights: The food is delicious, and it's not very often that you get food this great with happy hour prices, but there you go.
The space is very similar to Bar Marco, but the decor seems to lack the finish that Bar Marco has.
The staff were friendly and attentive - to be honest, I was expecting the pretentiousness you find at other cocktail bars in the area.

name: Donatos Fox Chapel
highlights: My wife is gluten free and they were extremely accommodating even making a special meatball for her.
The inside is decorated tastefully with neutral colors and dark woods  with the white linen table cloths that you would expect from a finer dining establishment.
Hope to come back here when we visit Pittsburgh again!

name: Atria’s Restaurant
highlights: Since we stayed a little longer than anticipated at our previous location, we only had about 45-50 minutes to order and eat before the Pirates game started.
Attached to PNC Park, this is a busy spot with inside and outdoor tables.
Great pee Pirates game food, great outdoor seating.

name: BD’s Mongolian Grill
highlights: It doesn't get crowded for lunch, but it does get pretty crowded for dinner every time I've been there.
There are no formalities here, the cooks sing when they get a tip and the customer gets to hit a gong.
BD's is a do it yourself with a little help all you can eat protein/vegetable/sauce party with a chef show in between preparation and eating.

name: YinzBurgh BBQ
highlights: But, he has a great selection of foods for vegheads & vegans to enjoy too, and specifies them as "Vegetarian" "Vegan" & "Gluten-Free" on his menu.
Parking is available across the street at Einstein Bros. after 2:30 PM otherwise there is street parking.
While other places think BBQ ends at slow-cooker pulled pork slopped on a bun with FMV sauce, this place knows what real BBQ is.

name: Dinette
highlights: --Little Neck Clam Pizza tasted like sopping up great bread in a big bowl of perfectly seasoned clams.
My favorite is the pie with arugula, freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, and just shaved prosciutto.
My favorite so far though has been an anchovy one, which has a bite to it from the hot peppers.

name: Vallozzis Pittsburgh
highlights: This is one of my go-to spots for happy hour downtown.
All went quickly and were amazing with the ricotta being a surprise favorite for me.
It came with their crab and corn chowder soup, caprese salad, gnocchi, and beef tenderloin.

name: Nak Won Garden
highlights: Today it's been wet Nd raining the entire afternoon and I skipped lunch so I was starving at around five.
They have it down to a science; the way they use marinade on beef bulgogi, Galbi ribs [1] and pork.
I've always been carving for samgyetang ever since Green Pepper stopped offering it ,therefore I'm so glad that it appears on Nak Won Garden's menu!

name: Bar Louie
address:
330 North Shore Dr
Bldg 1B
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15212

name: Groceria Italiana
highlights: They have a small deli with italian style meats and delicious cheese, they have salads and ready to eat hot food as well and they have tons of sauces, breads and pastas.
If you're lucky enough, you'll get a chance to see the raviolis being made in action by one of the lovely pasta making ladies.
If you're not in the mood to do your own cooking, you can always hit up their prepared foods section, too (where you'll find the pepperoni rolls).

name: Kevin’s Deli
highlights: They also do a mean breakfast, from bagels to hot stuff like omelets and hash browns.
Food was top tier and was delivered to my house around 9 am.
Kevin's Deli is inside of Webster Hall in Oakland and it's a great little deli that I've done for lunch many times.

name: Peppi’s
highlights: We were walking through the Strip and hopped in here because all the brunch places were packed.
Their portions are fabulous and they have or at last had a great lunch special, Italian sub, fries and a drink for like 8 bucks.
Peppi's is the creator of The #7 (nicknamed The Roethlisburger in homage to Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger).

name: Deli On North Avenue
highlights: Parking is a bit of a challenge, but once you touch down, you are always greeted at the counter by name.
They were all spectacular and would gladly order again, the chicken salad is also some of the best I've had.
I am saving my free replacement soup (Italian Wedding) for dinner but, I ate the Turkey Avocado Bleu Panini and WOW.

name: Hello Bistro
highlights: I do wish they had some more gluten-free dressing options but a minor quibble.
I made my own salad at hello bistro and the number of mix-ins is amazing and unbeatable!
What I hate about salads is not having enough dressing and/or mixing it into the lettuce completely.

name: Waffallonia
highlights: After looking everything over I decided on having the Bruges and a coffee while my girlfriend decided on the Charleroi.
I love waffles and I got the sugar waffle with bananas , Nutella and cinnamon ice cream it was amazing !
get the waffalonia sometime and add on nutella, ice cream, speculoos spread, whipped cream, strawberries and bananas.

name: Sonoma Grille
highlights: Anyhow I believe their marketing team says they have the best happy hour in the city or they've been voted that.
Sonoma Grille is regularly recognized as having one of the best wine selections in the city, and it's true.
We enjoyed great wine and a spectacular dish of crab tian which hands down is the best appetizer ever.

name: Pho Van
highlights: They have a pretty good vegetarian selection as wall, *including* veggie pho (without meat broth) which is quite a rarity.
The pho is excellent and the fresh shrimp rolls are the BEST summer rolls in the city.
I'm actually a fan of the rare eye round- the fresh meat cooks before your eyes in the broth, but the flank is a close second.

name: Mad Mex - Oakland
highlights: We come pretty often for happy hour (4:30 - 6:30) where you'll find half-off drafts and wings.
Highly suggest the Big Azz Margarita, but if tequila isn't your thing, try the sangria.
Definitely one of the to-go places if you're a college student on Pitt/CMU campus.

name: Roman Bistro
highlights: I met her the night prior for happy hour and had the amazing crab cake.
I ordered the pork osso bucco served with garlic polenta and sautéed broccoli with roasted tomatoes.
my favorite is the beet salad.

name: Kickback Pinball Cafe
highlights: Enjoyed playing some pinball while teaching the kids the art of a good flipper.
Kickback is now BYOB, which is great, but the cost to B your own B is pretty high.
A few tables I saw last included The Walking Dead, Medieval Madness and several fantastic other tables.

name: Sushi & Rolls
highlights: Sometimes I even skip lunch and leave work early to pick up rolls for dinner before they close at 5.
Sushi can be hard to come by downtown, so any one passing through, hanging out , or working downtown please go into oxford center and try sushi and rolls.
Don't be put off by the food court - this is not fast food quality.

name: Rudy Martino Original House of Submarines
Pho Minh
highlights: My friends around the table tried different pho as well as some vegetarian tofu stir fry, and I didnt hear a complaint..
Pretty disappointing to me, but luckily the table was equipped with homemade Sriracha-like sauce and the ubiquitous chili-in-oil sauce found in cafes all over Vietnam.
Cash only, closed on Tuesdays.

name: East End Food Co-Op
highlights: No matter what kind of health-conscious diet you follow from vegan to paleo - they've got what you need.
It provides for all of our gluten-free, dairy-free needs - and even allows the opportunity to purchase in bulk as a member.
It's also stocked with the best produce anywhere in the city in the winter months when Giant Eagle's selection looks beat up.

name: Restaurant Hana
highlights: I'm looking forward to taking advantage of their great lunch prices for sushi combos and take-out often in the future.
The presentation is great and I will continue to get delivery anytime I have the hankering for Asian or sushi.
Decent food and certainly a step up from the normal 'Burgh formulaic oriental fare.

name: Local Brewhouse
highlights: Great happy hour specials on food and drink.
It's a great place to hang out and have a few drinks and just relax, although I would imagine it's gets packed during Steelers and Pirates games though.
We had some delicious wings - bigger sized than you get at most sports bars these days - along with some soft pretzels with good dipping sauces.

name: Morton’s The Steakhouse
highlights: Six ounce filet with scallops and shrimp cooked perfectly.
Overall: This is a great place to celebrate a special occasion if you're willing to splurge!
Afterwards we finished our bottle of Spellbound Merlot, signed up for the Landry's Select Club and enjoyed the remainder of our evening!

name: Krista’s Cantina
highlights: One of my favorite places for fantastic wings.
My "go to" flavors are BBQ gold and mild garlic parm!
This is a great neighborhood bar with good food and good drink specials!

name: Aiello’s Pizza
highlights: I grew up in Forest Hills (east of Pittsburgh) which means I was born and raised to love and worship Vincent's Pizza Park.
Street parking can be a hassle as you have to pay to park on murray.
The pepperoni roll was BOMB, so good, I loved the little bit of burnt cheese around the edges, so yummy.

name: The Huddle
highlights: Aside from the wings, I'm a huge fan of their Reuben and their monstrous grilled cheese.
It is one of my favorite spots to go for drinks with friends, wing night, or a dinner date.
Cash only and reasonably priced as well.

name: Bloomfield Bridge Tavern
highlights: Ask if they are doing any sort of happy hour and try some Polish beer, you can't go wrong here!
They also have a nice little selection of Polish beers and sometimes have live music.
My husband and I both opted for the red platter which had sausage, kluski, haluski, pierogi and stuffed cabbage.

name: The Enrico Biscotti
highlights: AAdorbsssssss
They have other Italian desserts, I love the coconut macaroon which is the size of my fist and dipped in chocolate.
Just the smell of fresh bread alone when we walked in made me fall in love with the place.

name: Salem’s Market & Grill
highlights: Easy parking too - they are far enough off the main part of the strip away from the hoi polloi.
When I walked in, I was suprised by the "cafeteria" set-up, with a large open area to sit and eat, a very casual atmosphere indeed.
Prices are also very reasonable for the huge portions, you will definitely have left overs!

name: Hard Rock Cafe
highlights: I saw a robe Elvis wore in one of movies; we saw a keytar Stevie Wonder played; a guitar from the Motley Crew; Michael Jackson jacket; It was cool.
I like Station Square a lot and the parking garage makes it easy and convenient to go to (unlike other areas of the city where parking is an annoyance).
I believe, the band started playing around 9 and could get pretty loud if you're dinning inside in the main/bar area.
address:
230 W Station Sq Dr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Drew’s Family Restaurant
highlights: Drew's was easy to find and we had no problems with parking.
The dinner plates are all very good, and the corned beef hash is wonderful!
But get there early, anyone on the know, knows that Greek Night is NOT to be missed at this fine restaurant.

name: Birmingham Bridge Tavern
highlights: It's tucked away in the far end from Carson on a back street making parking a bit easier and definately a breath taking establishment and a great place to watch the sports games at!
Monday and Wednesday is their wing night.
Wings came out in about 15 minutes, 5 perfectly crisp with dry jerk seasoning (9 out of 10) and 5 golden boy sauce (mustardy hot, 10!!!).

name: Spirit Lodge
highlights: Solid happy hour, great pizza, and amazing parties.
From well-dressed yuppies to hipsters to older Yinzers to the random wanderers, everyone is always smiling and having a good time.
Some of the best pizza in the city (in my opinion), great dance nights and a friendly, knowledgable bar staff.

name: Lindos Restaurant
highlights: I have never been here for anything other than breakfast but it is great.
This is a great grab a burger or in my case grab a Reuben Sandwich place before the Steelers game on your way to the stadium.
I can hardly believe you get two eggs, home fires bacon or sausage, pancakes and French toast for $7.99.

name: Grandma B’s
highlights: Love the French toast, pancakes, shrimp and grits, beef bacon, beef sausage....
The cook made small talk with my husband & I and made us feel comfortable while we waited.
The guy was so cool he made me one French toast, and one pancake so I could try both!!

name: Emilliano’s Mexican Restaurant and Bar
highlights: They have great drink specials around happy hour so I definitely recommend taking advantage of them to unwind from work.
Free chips and salsa, keeps your mind off waiting for your food, and the fresh chips and salsa were excellent.
If you're feeling particularly ambitious, try their sangria margarita (also made in house).

name: Millie’s Homemade Ice Cream
highlights: This area of Shadyside is tricky for parking - we ended up over the bridge and in a parking garage for PetsMart.
I settled with a scoop of lavender and a scoop of Vietnamese coffee in a waffle cone and it was delicious!
Pretty long line for a Saturday so I felt a little pressured to order quickly, and only tried 2 flavors (Thai Iced Tea and Coconut Lime).

name: Palmyra Mediterrean Cuisine
highlights: A falafel sandwich and an order of vegetarian grape leaves were $8.
He happily hands out a falafel dipped in hummus to patrons waiting in line.
I tried gyro, the meat stuffed grape leaves, and the cheese, meat pies.

name: Brighton Hot Dog Shoppe
highlights: I've also enjoyed the breakfast here, and this place definitely gets crowded on weekend mornings.
The chili fries were a little gross, but the burger and hot dog were on the money.
Frank (their mascot has a name after all) has made it into the outskirts of Pittsburgh.

name: Uncle Sam’s Submarines
highlights: Their cheesesteaks are fantastic, as are their fries (both potato and sweet potato).
I just wish they put hot sauce on every table as I'm usually searching it out in the dining area.
I went to college near by and would use Uncle Sams as a place to treat myself to some good grub and great leftovers.

name: Packs & Dogs
highlights: And parking is always at a premium on the Mountain, so be sure you're ready to walk from the downstairs parking area, connected to the adjacent lot.
They do it right with a Vienna Beef frank (though it's skinless) weighing in at a quarter pound!
Thank GOD Pennsylvania doesn't have food laws like they have alcohol laws or I'd be in trouble.

name: Pizza Milano
highlights: Not your average pizza place, love it here, great happy hour, bartender was great, met some local girls here.
Right next to Consol Energy Center too for any touring peeps!
I started college at Duquesne in 2005 and experienced my first Milano's pizza.

name: Hough’s
highlights: I particularly like the Happy Hour from 4pm-6pm M-F. Pint draughts are just $4 and there are specials on their Small Eats.
The brunch menu is awesome- really unique items like honey nut Cheerios crusted French toast and a chicken and waffle sandwich.
We got the Chicken and Waffles Sandwich and the Roasted Reuben, two things I would highly recommend and get again.

name: Casa Reyna
highlights: I got the vegetarian tacos loaded with tender roasted vegetables, cilantro and onions topped with a tasty mild taco sauce.
Casa Reyna was off to a great start with crispy, warm, non-greasy chips and four amazing salsas.
Yes, it's in a basement and kind of dungeon-y, but the food is out of this world.

name: Diamond Market Bar & Grill
highlights: Somewhere between a diner and a bar, this local spot had some great menu options and a pretty good happy hour.
We were in Pittsburgh to see a Pirates game and stopped in the Diamond Market Bar & Grill as we walked through Market Square on the way to PNC Park.
Mediterranean Chicken Sandwich:  Fresh and very tasty.

name: Stone Neapolitan Pizzeria
highlights: So for as little as $1.36 you can upgrade from the unfathomable frozen abyss to life-affirming pizza glory.
I'd say the quality of ingredients here are near the qualities of Piccolo Forno in Lawrenceville and Dinette in Shadyside/East Liberty.
The bianca with chili oil is delicious with any topping, the margherita is also great with a nice tomato sauce and fresh mozzeralla and basil.

name: Big Shot Bob’s House of Wings - Beechview
highlights: The wings are BIG -constantly cooked correctly, always crispy, never soggy.
Julie has an awesome personality and she makes great salads.

name: Big Jim’s Restaurant & Bar
highlights: Parking is super easy, the neighborhood looks a little sketch but I've ran here at night in the dark and it seems fine.
He pointed out photos of before they were open and a big portrait of Big Jim himself looking all Tony Soprano.
I had seen this featured on food networks DDD with guy fieri, and combined with a strong yelp rating, figured this was worth a stop.

name: Ali Baba
highlights: I usually get the 'Vegetarian Special' which is box with rice, hummus and baba ganoush (and bread).
The Shiska Bob is to die for and the Falafal is absolutely delicious, and I love how they give you a salad with your meal,  and the hummus is delicious too.
We ordered the maza platter that had hummus, baba ghanooj, artichoke and tabooli salads, feta cheese, olives and tomatoes, as well as pita bread.

name: Gio’s Cafe
highlights: They have breakfast items, crapes, salads, sandwiches, wraps, espresso drinks and more.
I got ham with horshradish crepe for lunch and it was $8 and came with a salad.
If you happen to be in downtown or looking for a food a delivery, this is a must try and I definitely recommend this place.

name: Big Shot Bob’s House of Wings - South Side
Sun Penang
highlights: I went there once for lunch and had one of their Malaysian noodle soup dishes which was pretty good but not amazing.
I really do not recommend the pad thai but would like to go back to try the other noodle and rice dishes.
I'm most impressed with their Shiu Mei and Roti Canai as far as apps go.

name: Redhawk Coffee
highlights: Parking was street parking, and don't think you can just stop and not get ticketed because in the span of the 2 hours my friend and I hung out there, we watched at least 4 people get ticketed.
Highly recommend trying this out and supporting the local business.
Also, they serve their cold brew in glass bottles, which makes me feel hip as heck.

name: Korea Garden
highlights: Although the menu is a little bit overpriced, lunch bento offers an economy choice.
FOOD:  We always get the ja-jang myun which is very flavorful.
The food is a little bit pricy but less expensive than Green Pepper and more authentic than Oiishi Bento.

name: Aracri’s Greentree Inn
highlights: Love,love, loved their onion rings.
My only gripes are the limited selection at the bar and I feel the prices for food are very expensive for the portions you receive.

name: Savoy
highlights: We enjoyed wine with our meals, as well as the fabulous sounds of Roger Humphries and his band the RH Factor, the featured band for Jazz Night.
I'm a sucker for restaurants with modern atmospheres and Savoy doesn't disappoint in this regard.
The Sunday Brunch is a definite for any wanting to get out before the game come on.

name: Jimmy Wans
highlights: They offer an amazing happy hour special with deals on drinks and food.
sauteed eggplant - 4.5 stars!
Best Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh and the best restaurant in the Fox Chapel area.

name: Bombay Gyro’s and Lunch Box
highlights: Choose 3 from about 8 different dishes, some with meat and some vegan.
I like this place more than Sree's. There, I said it!
The siracha complimented the sauce so well.

name: Houlihan’s
highlights: All of the prices are quite reasonable, especially during happy hour, which is one of the best!
recommend getting one of the large glasses of long islands as they are huge and come in all different flavors.
Must try the mushroom appetizer - stuffed with Parmesan cheese and a horseradish sauce.
address:
125 W Station Square Drive
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Bob’s Garage
highlights: This is a magical wonderland of lights, alcohol, cheer and karaoke connoisseurs.
Kitchy place to check out, especailly during holidays, when they go crazy with decorations.
If you are in the area at Christmas time it shouldn't be missed.

name: Los Cabos Mexican Restaurant
highlights: Great options for vegetarians which always scores brownie points in my book.
They also have Carne Asada fries, which was something I thought was cool on the west coast that I hadn't seen here.
With that being said, get the California Burrito!

name: Bill’s Bar & Burger
highlights: The appetizers are also 1/2 off from 4-7 (love the longer happy hour) and we went with the mini hotdogs.
Would recommend that you eat at the bar -Lisa is the best, she's knows the menu and knows her hockey!
If my wife's fries were as perfect as the sweet potato fries, I'd have likely given Bill's five stars.
address:
Westin Convention Center
1001 Liberty Ave
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15222

name: BRGR
highlights: Before going to an elite event in east liberty, my boyfriend and I decided to check out BRGR for happy hour!
Between all of these factors, it's a close toss-up, but Burgatory has a slight edge on food quality/innovativeness and value.
I'd recommend the Button Buster for your burger, and a Scotty Karate beer to accompany.

name: Red Hot Pittsburgh
address:
Corner of Grant & Oliver
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Eat Unique
highlights: They have a ton of options for people who have gluten allergies, are dairy free or are vegetarian/vegan so props to them, but nothing shouts "OMG" to me.
Their Mushroom Melt, Southwest Sizzler, and especially their Summer Sandwich, are all delicious, and fairly reasonably priced to boot.
Eat Unique has a great menu full of unique sandwiches and salads that leaves Panera in the dust.

name: Roland’s Seafood Grill
highlights: They have great happy hour specials and a huge selection of beers on tap.
There aren't too many things better in life than a Roland's hot lobster roll on Mancini's grilled bread.
I'd like to go back and enjoy their upstairs patio & a lobster roll!

name: Pizza Prima
highlights: Whether ordering a whole pie for delivery or stopping by to pick up a slice or two for lunch or a late night snack I'm always greeted with a smile and a genuine thank-you for my business.
If you aren't in the mood for pizza, all of the hot subs are great as are the huge calzones - again, it's that crust!
The little old Italian man who runs the store doesn't beat around the bush but is friendly.

name: Clark Bar & Grill
highlights: I recommend stopping there during a game if you know how to maneuver with game day traffic and parking.
P.P.S. I don't know how busy this place gets during Pirates or Steelers games since nothing was going on when we visited yesterday evening aside from the concert.
Got tickets to the ZoSo concert at Stage AE and decided to switch up my pre-lube location from something other than the Tilted Kilt, River Towne or Bettis Grill.

name: Pamela’s Upstreet Diner
highlights: Obviously, not the place to go if you're trying to eat healthy, but their salty lyonnaise potatoes and buttery hotcakes are amazing for a Saturday brunch.
The egg whites veggie omelette was a home run, the Lyonnaise potatoes are killer, and even the black coffee was perfect.
I went with the suggestions by my fellow Yelpers and ordered the strawberry hotcakes.

name: Ruths Chris Steak House
highlights: I hate the parking, location and navigating downtown.
For our main meal, my husband had the 22oz Cowboy ribeye rare, while I ordered the filet medium.
As the 500 degree plate came out with the glorious aroma of perfectly cooked meat sizzling in butter, I knew I was not only in for something special, but a livelong love.

name: Maiku Sushi
highlights: I did but my lunch friends didn't.  We just craved something filling and comforting so I suggested Pho.
Vietnam's pho has merged with Maiku Sushi and they will now be serving an expanded menu including vietnamese options as well as sushi.
The spring rolls are a nice appetizer if you think you can scarf down more than a bowl of pho.

name: City Oven
highlights: Menu is Flatbread pizza (14" or a slice) of various traditional styles, plus meat lovers, garden veggie and buffalo chicken.
Meat lovers and buffalo chicken.
All specialty  sandwiches are  $7.99, and house sandwiches,  $4.99-6.99, all available on white or wheat, or on flatbread.

name: Beto’s Pizza
highlights: If you need a Salad , maybe go back to California and eat your wheat grass.
The sauce is full of flavor and the mounds of fresh grated mozzarella cheese never disappoint.
If you want carry out call it in, as I've found myself waiting 25 minutes when I thought I'd swing by and pick up a few slices.

name: Andy’s Sushi Bar
highlights: This sushi stand is only open for lunch, and typically closes at about 4pm on a weekday.
This place is a small stand within Wholey's, which is itself an awesome store of fresh seafood.
Andy is super entertaining, and serves up the best sushi in the burg!

name: The Pretzel Shop
highlights: I almost always can find parking right outside the shop since it's not in the crazy crazy part of East Carson.
I picked the best day possible - National Pretzel Day - so I got a handful of extra pretzel nugs tossed in my bag as a treat.
If you really want then fresh out of the oven, head to the rear entrance on Carey Way early in the morning like my grandpap used to.

name: Giorgio’s Place
highlights: I also really enjoy the thin crust pizza especially when I get the pepperoni and meatball toppings.
They're cash only, which is a bummer, but there is an ATM a few steps away at the Modern Cafe.
Parking would be the worst part, but I'm sure the north east are is a lot different than Houston, not everything is in a strip center lol.

name: Apsara Cafe
highlights: Yes, Carson St is a hoppin place Thursday through Sat night, but those wanting a great dining experience are not going to fight the South Side crowds, and parking, to go out to eat.
The dish was fresh, tasty, and dare I saw somewhat more satisfying than a traditional pad thai.
One of the few places where I can find Cambodian food in Pittsburgh, so I am pretty interested in trying some of the more exclusive things.

name: Redbeard’s Bar & Grill
highlights: Great atmosphere, excellent service, plenty of parking across the street.
The inside is a little loud and close quarters for me on busy days; I'd much rather sit in their outside area.
The shrimp jammers were very good and I liked my Pulled Pork sammich.

name: Spak Brothers Pizza and More
highlights: There are many veg-friendly options, notably those with seitan (wheat gluten) substituted for meat.
I always get an order of the seitan wings with vegan buffalo sauce and vegan ranch (get extra).
The rule of thumb is to try their seitan melts, especially with vegan cheese, it is heaven in a hoagie.

name: Coca Cafe
highlights: I hesitated in giving if 5 stars just because I don't want to see this amass lines on weekend brunch!
My daughter had the challah french toast with strawberries and fig jam - delish; I had one of the omelettes - very nice.
The Eggplant Benedict is probably my favorite, but the Shrimp and Grits is a close second.

name: Make Your Mark
highlights: Every day there are new specials that are house-made and always vegetarian or vegan.
Fine weather has me out on the back patio, admiring the cherry blossoms and downing yet another magnificent panini or quesadilla or wrap-thing.
I had the Nutella pound cake, which was, with anything containing Nutella, delicious!

name: P&G’s Pamela’s Diner
highlights: I do think that this is the best location, after breakfast or brunch you can stroll through Shadyside.
other things to try: corned beef hash is yummmmy.
They season the corned beef so well that it gives the whole dish this heavenly taste.

name: Terrace Room
highlights: At brunch we got house made fudge choco tacos for dessert, and the burgers and sandwiches at lunch are low on pretension and high on flavor.
The dining room is impressive, with high ceilings, ornate chandeliers, a huge mural, and stone everywhere.
There is a full bar and there is an extension of the restaurant into the hotel lobby where you can stalk passerbys.

name: Ritters Diner
highlights: So for brunch, I ordered a steak breakfast that came with eggs, home fries and toast.
The places is bumping on a weekend morning with spotty service but serves an awesome breakfast.
Jukeboxes lined the perimeter of the dining room and abstract sculptures of labyrinthine iron jutted from sides of the booths.

name: Steelhead Brasserie and Wine Bar
highlights: My co-worker and I had a great lunch at the Steelhead today.
Can get a bit crowded even when there isn't a hockey game.
My husband had the mushroom truffle burger which he is still raving about 2 weeks later.

name: Original Hot Dog Shop
highlights: Secure Parking is available around the corner at S Bouquet St & Sennott St for a few bucks.
Order a small fry; they place a tiny container on a plate , then empty the entire fry basket of fries on to it.
The french fries are greasy and amazing and you get to choose a dipping sauce-my favorite is cheese but you can get gravy or ranch too.

name: Reyna Foods
highlights: I discovered today that the taco stand in front of Reyna's offers two types of vegan tacos!
I love the taco stand outside of Reyna's. I've tried all of the tacos that they have to offer and wasn't disappointed with any of them.
Give them a shot, and they are wonderful with all the fresh made salsas they carry in the deli cooler by the registers.

name: Patron Mexican Grill
highlights: Free chips and salsa and big portions, too!
Favorites are camarones patron, fish tacos, arroz con pollo, sopapillas, and flan.
Much better than Tex-American-Mexican wanna be's like Mad Max.

name: Café Cravings
highlights: Breakfast sandwiches all day long, great lattes, pumpkin spice, everything you like about the chain places and a nice atmosphere.
Some mornings it can be a little busy in there with the regulars from Chatham Village, but I don't mind waiting and chatting it up.
The local coffee shop you see in the movies that you think doesn't really exist, well it does and this is it.

name: Bistro To Go
highlights: It's pretty typical brunch fare that is done well (get the french toast!), but what really stood out to me was the atmosphere.
The service from Nikki and her team could not be better.
The catering for our wedding itself was professional, and the food wasn't incredibly different than what we tried at the restaurant (usually not the case).
address:
415 E Ohio St
Ste A
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15212

name: The Dream BBQ
highlights: The pork ribs didn't have much mea ton the bone but they turkey ribs were amazingly most with plenty of meat and flavor.
Service was outstanding and the honey mustard sauce is unlike any other.
We ordered a full rack of ribs and for sides we got the yams and mac & cheese.

name: McCormick & Schmick’s Seafood & Steaks
highlights: Can't beat the happy hour during the week, and happy hour food prices at the bar all day Sunday!
I normally don't like trout but I wanted to give it a try.
try the chocolate bucket (?)

name: Coal Hill Steakhouse at Grandview Saloon
Gateway Clipper Cafe
address:
224 W Station Square Dr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: The Pita Pit
highlights: Pay parking is available on the streets, although you could park on a residential street and walk if you didn't want to pay to park.
A healthy alternative to fast food they offer fresh poultry and various grilled meats with a variety of delicious veggies packed into a pita pocket.
Tons of veggie options, and if you don't like pitas, you can always get your pita turned into a salad!
address:
2763 E Carson St
Unit C-105
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15203

name: Franktuary
highlights: Great options (including vegan options), so it is good for everyone.
But I digress--you can get anything from a plain dog to traditional condiments (think onions and ketchup) to fancy toppings like kimchee or pierogies, or just a nice juicy chili dog.
I was a regular at the old location in the basement of the church,  so the new location took some getting used to.

name: Yovi’s
highlights: The owners are very friendly, efficient, and always deliver great tasting food.
The French fries were some of the best I've ever had, and the Chicago dog was also very good (very authentic presentation).
As soon as you walk in there is a life-size photo of Mike Ditka and a Chicago skyline photo that takes up most of the wall.
address:
477 Graeme St Market Sq
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15222

name: Osteria 2350
highlights: Osteria 2350 also has wine and beer on the menu to compliment your meal, and parking is validated for the on-site garage, so no need to worry about parking in the Strip!
The Riccolina had this Fede pasta in it that I had never tried before.
I can't remember all of the entrees at the table, but I do remember we had carbonara, gnocchi, chicken Piccata, and chicken Parmesan.

name: Allegheny Sandwich Shoppe
highlights: excellent brunch place on the north side.
I had a ham and cheese omelet with home fries, and it was by far one of the best breakfasts I have ever had.
They GRIND their own coffee there, so they have the best coffee of any breakfast place I've tried.

name: Remedy
highlights: I like coming after work for happy hour and then heading home.
The best time to go is for the dance party upstairs, which hosts a diverse crowd, pool tables, good music, cheap PBR, and a nice dance floor.
The only thing I could go without is all the smoke in the bar, but this is coming from a non-smoker.

name: The Shady Dog
address:
Corner Of Baum And Libert
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15232

name: The Hop House
highlights: Occasional Live Bands, Happy Hour Specials, Texas Hold'em Night, Free Pizza and other goodies are normal here.
The portions are huge, the side choices plentiful, the staff is great, and there's always a game or two on their plethora of flat screen TVs.
Thursday night is all-you-can-eat pasta, so $8 gets you plenty of dinner and enough for lunch the next day!

name: Original Oyster House
highlights: This will definitely become a regular lunch spot for me (if, that is, I can find enough people in the 'burgh who actually like seafood).
We just finished the Cajun breaded white fish it was delicious wife had French fries I had fried oysters they where great.
The basket was sufficient without the vinegar, yet I enjoyed it so much that I decided to generously apply it to.

name: Dijlah Restaurant
highlights: P.S. I peeked behind a curtain in the back while I was waiting for someone to vacate the men's restroom and noticed not only a hookah bar but a dancefloor (!)
We ordered a Combination Plate appetizer (hummus, babaganush, grape leaves, and tabuleh served with pita bread).
I got the Iraqi kebabs and it came with rice and a tasty but simple salad that was amazing.

name: Silk Elephant
highlights: Lunch deal is great - soup, salad, vegetable roll, and entree all for less than $9.00 bar tenders are ON POINT for happy hour :)
My few forays into the world of Thai cuisine have been interesting, Silk Elephant only adding more depth to that memoir.
You can get a wide variety of curry entrees at the Bangkok Balcony, but you won't find very many curry-inspired tapas.
address:
1712 Murray Ave
Squirrel Hill
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15217

name: Stinky’s Bar & Grill
highlights: The menu is rather huge and includes pizza, burgers, sandwiches, salads, pasta, wings, and anything else a bar might serve.
I don't partake, but my friends and some other regulars do, and it's highly entertaining.
I love the banter during hockey games, the drink specials which always leave me walking (er, stumbling) down butler street content and slightly drunk.

name: Deli on Butler Street
highlights: Gary the owner, clearly takes pride in his business and it shows in both the level of cleanliness of his establishment and in the product he delivers.
The chef and Cobb salads are great and I love the Avocado Blue Panini!
Perfect lunch spot when you're in a rush or not in the mood to think because everything is well made, tasty, and simple.

name: Tequila Cowboy Bar & Grill
highlights: The happy hour prices are the best I have seen, Monday-Friday 4PM-7PM.
The bull was entertaining and hilarious!
Place starts getting busy around 10pm.

name: Pizza Perfectta
highlights: On a recent to trip to Pittsburgh I tried alot of pizza and this was good pizza.
I've ordered the Wings with Garlic and Parm, which comes in a oven-safe container for leftovers.
Well done, a good flavorful sauce, and just the right amount of crust.

name: Nancettas Ristorante
highlights: The owners, Nancy and Paul, were great hosts and added a touch of "personal" to the whole brunch.
And my husband had the braised short ribs with the homemade pasta we ate everything down to the bone!!!
Dinner we ordered the gnocchi with pesto, the wild boar over risotto, and the bolognese with short rib.

name: Nellie’s Sandwiches
highlights: The vegetarian grape leaves are delicious (much better than the meat ones), with a nice lemony sauce.
I have also had one of their samplers including the hummus, grape leaves, and spanakopita and they were all perfection.
so flavorful with the parsley and citrus, man it's good on a ripped pita section!

name: Storms Restaurant & Catering
highlights: Leaving with a bill under $50 made paying for downtown parking a little less painful.
The location of this restaurant is in the basement of a law office that only stays open until 7pm.
This place is definitely a hidden gem.

name: Tilted Kilt Pub & Eatery
highlights: The fries were crunchy and not over done, and the burger was a large 10oz. burger done perfectly.
Fun place to stop in when walking on the North Shore, and can't go wrong with some wings or the ribs!
Although we were planning on going to the Pirates game, which we found out was sold out when we arrived. . .

name: Redfin Blues
highlights: Great lunch and great location for relaxing.
I found out that this restaurant was built as a sort of a stopping destination for all the boats out in the river.
They have a large parking lot and the outdoor seating was seat yourself.

name: August Henry’s City Saloon
highlights: It seems that this place is an awesome after work happy hour spot.
I recently visited Pittsburgh for a weekend and stayed near the convention center.
I'm not sure how many people the dining area can accommodate.

name: Ka Mei
highlights: Bone-in roast duck was the Most Delicious Roast Duck Ever!
My menu favs include: Pork and Preserved Egg Congee, Cold Chicken, and young pea sprouts.
Almost always orders the Chicken Steamed with Chinese Mushrooms, Steamed Spared Ribs, and also one of the only restaurants you can get Congee in Pittsburgh.

name: Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen
highlights: My co-worker, who frequently eats vegetarian meals turned me on to this and I couldn't thank her enough.
I work in the area, so we've had our orders delivered and they always arrive before the expected time, which is great!
The grape leaves were a bit dry but still preferable to the overly saturated ones you find in cans or at the Greek olive bars in grocery stores.

name: McCormick & Schmick’s Seafood & Steaks
highlights: You really cannot beat the prices to enjoy such high-quality food; especially when the happy hour is offered Monday-Saturday!
We had an assortment of appetizers to split which included Coconut Shrimp with a mango sauce, Quesadillas, Stuffed Mushrooms, and Oysters.
For dinner my dining companion and I decided to start off our meals by splitting the calamari.

name: Bangkok Balcony
highlights: The reason I deduct a star - last time I was there with a friend who is also a vegetarian, we ordered a tofu pad thai and found a few small pieces of chicken in it.
Chunks of soft, buttery pumpkin with a light coconut milk-infused curry sauce.
Another worthy member of Pittsburgh's fantastic Thai scene, the Bangkok Balcony doesn't disappoint.

name: Winghart’s Burger & Whiskey Bar
highlights: They have $4 draft happy hour specials and a great list to choose from.
The Market Square's homemade mustard was top notch, and the Shipwreck burger was all around amazing.
My medium rare cooked patty is topped with brie cheese, caramelized onions with bacon, arugula, and white truffle aioli.

name: Asiatique Thai Bistro
highlights: I usually go with Pad Thai, or pineapple fried rice.
Note: BYOB...and they don't charge a corking fee!!!
Had the king chicken which was tasty.

name: Mad Mex - Shadyside
highlights: I usually get the $3 little butt margaritas on happy hour special so that I can try a few flavors including the new Sangria margarita.
The food is always good, especially the picka dippa XX cheese and black bean dip.
Lots of vegan options from vegan ranch, daiya cheese, tofutti sour cream, tofu, portobello and seitan.

name: DJ’s Sandwich Shoppe
highlights: Best steak salad I've ever eaten (it helps when the steak is super high quality).
I am def going to try the frog legs at some point in the future.
The chili cheese dogs are fantastic, the chili truly is the star of the show!

name: Pamela’s
highlights: We never wait too long there, even when there's a line and can usually find parking on the street with relative ease.
This has to be one of my favorite breakfast spots in Pittsburgh and I do not come here nearly enough.
Two eggs over easy, sausage links (my absolute favorite), lyonnaise potatoes, and two crepe style pancakes.

name: Pizza Care
highlights: Reasonable (maybe a little pricey) prices, but they have a lot of options (plain, whole wheat, whole grain, & gluten-free crust) and nice, fresh ingredients.
No preservatives or trans fat, use olive oil in their crusts, healthy crust options & their cheese is all natural.
The delivery driver was extremely nice making sure I had everything secured so it didn't topple over.

name: Gandy Dancer Saloon
highlights: Located in the, well, grand Grand Concourse building, right next to the restaurant, Gandy Dancer puts on a killer Happy Hour every weeknight.
They adore the Grand Concourse & Gandy Dancers Selection.
My mom got her favorite soup the Charley's Chowder & my dad got the diner burger & they enjoyed their meals as well.
address:
100 W Station Sq Dr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: The Garden Cafe
address:
600 Penn Ave
Heinz Hall
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15222

name: The BeerHive
highlights: Two...they're going to start breakfast/brunch, with chicken & waffles and "upscale" breakfast food.
We also stopped back on the way out of town to buy a few jars of the pickles...affordable and delicious!
It seems like any beer drinker could find something they love there.

name: Hokkaido Seafood Buffet
highlights: it is good place a lot of a sorties foods nice service prices aslo is good lunch 9$ dinner 18 $
After my stomach has stretched to new heights I like to finish off with my final cool down, some marshmallows run through the chocolate fountain.
The food offerings run the gamut from pizza to pig's ears and chicken feet.

name: Mineo’s Pizza House
highlights: They have a happy hour Monday through Wednesday 9pm-10pm that has $2 off drinks (which are moderately priced to begin with).
I grew up in Pittsburgh on Mineo's and Aiello's and on every return visit, it is a mandatory stop.
Yes, you'll want to dab off some of the grease with a napkin, but the crust is perfection and the sauce has a wonderful, gentle spicy kick.

name: Vincent’s Pizza Park
highlights: From time to time, I've been dismayed to read reviews from pizza lovers who did not like the Vinnie Pie.
You don't know Pittsburgh, nor can you call yourself a true Pittsburgher unless you've had a Vinnie pie.
It took dedicated restraint not to immediately rip into the grease spotted, hot paper-covered cardboard slabs as we sped home.

name: Quik-It Chicken
highlights: From mac and cheese to beans to yams, to the ribs and wings, there's more than one reason to visit Quik-It Chicken.
Best soul food in pittsburgh straight-up.
Best place for lunch in the city.

name: STACK’D Burgers & Beer
highlights: --$1 off all drinks during Happy Hour weekdays until 7 (not sure when it starts), and $6 Yuengling pitchers until midnight.
Also, you can't beat the Tuesday night stack'd burger special, but I'd still go back any other time of the day.
The veggie and regular patties have great flavor and could stand on their own - but this place is called STACK'D for a reason.

name: V3 Flatbread Pizza
highlights: This is a great option for people with specialized diets too, with no-cheese Vegan  pizzas and Gluten-free dough as well!
A friend suggested we go to V3 before the Alton Brown event and was so happy she did - I am digging these Chipotle-esque pizza joints recently.
After it's cooked, you can even doctor it up with "finishers" (cheeses, oils, etc.) to add the final piece de resistance to your creation.

name: Jozsa Corner
highlights: When you call, you can provide dietary restrictions, e.g. indicating that you would prefer vegetarian versions of the dishes.
Alex the chef and owner is larger than life and he is on a mission to share the Hungarian food and cultural traditions.
Again, would definitely recommend, but call a week or two in advance, and BYOB (including soft drinks, tea, etc.).

name: Excuses Bar & Grill
highlights: Totally a local dive bar and the drinks are cheap which at that point you've got me sold.
There's often a live band playing, a Pens game on the TV, or some awesomely bad karaoke going down.
Never thought I'd have a reason to go here, but what do you know, a friend and I found ourselves in this area of Southside and was looking for a place that might have cheap drinks.

name: Taste of India
highlights: Just got back from trying the lunch buffet at Taste of India, which was pretty good and a definite value.
Now, as soon as I get home, I can't wait to get some spicy lamb curry and their paneer makhni.
After one evening in a modest Lawrenceville storefront, a new cuisine had captured my imagination, heart, and palate.

name: Giovanni’s Pizza & Pasta
highlights: This might be tied for my favorite pizza of all time (held by Crossroads of Hellertown PA).
Just keep in mind that delivery does take a while, so be patient.
If you like a sweeter sauce and dough (a la Fiori's) that delivers, Giovanni's is solid every time.

name: Eggs-R-Us
highlights: Eggs R' Us was easy to find and we had no problems with parking.
Cellone's yields a firmer toast which I believe is much better and tastier--good choice Eggs-R-Us!
Eggs R Us is a greasy spoon, ma & pap, locally owned/operated, Pittsburgh gem.

name: Chinatown Inn
highlights: So we all did a little sampling of ginger and garlic shrimp, curry roast pork, and some vegetarian dishes.
I frequently have Silver Palace deliver food to me and I have dined in before.
My boyfriend and I were craving Chinese food while we were in town for the weekend, and boy, am I glad I found this gem!

name: SAKE Asian Cuisine & Sushi Bar
highlights: I like the Gyozo, and if you go during happy hour, there's have price apps and drinks.
Service can be slow here but don't let that keep you away.
I had a groupon so I could not take advantage of their specially priced menu, but Sunday through Thursday they have VERY cheap prices on their menu.

name: Thai Hana
highlights: The sushi I had was phenomenal and really made with tons of attention to deal, even at lunch time.
I ordered from Thai Hana using GrubHub.
Two dish recommendations: Basil Fried Rice and Drunken Noodles.

name: North Shore Deli
highlights: The ends were crispy and delicious and the sausage was just hot enough that the macaroni salad was the perfect cool salad compliment.
My only suggestion would be for them to sell extra sauce (extra .50, maybe) with the hot sausage.
There are about 20 different sandwiches to try, so no shortage of options.

name: Paris 66
highlights: W had the Brunch that included a cream filled crepe with berry puree, eggs provencale, and beautiful croissant.
I've had a difficult time finding perfect buckwheat crepes in a town like Pittsburgh but Paris 66 Bistro blows this out of the water.
Thanks to my man Darren for bringing me here for my late birthday and for buying me a box of their excellent macaroons to go.

name: Smallman Street Deli
highlights: They are very accommodating with gluten sensitivity.
For when I'm not on that diet, their reubens and matzo ball soup are absolutely amazing.
I have never been a big fan of corned beef, but my friends have always loved the Reuben and Rachel.

name: Benny Fierro’s
highlights: Does anyone remember the days of Pizza Sola and how huge their slices were but also how sort of lacking in awesomeness of flavor they were?
Benny's has the right amount of toppings, the perfect crust (not too doughy, not too hard) and just the right amount of sweetness in their sauce.
The service is pretty good, friendly and fast, even with a lunch crowd.

name: Smallman Street Deli
highlights: I tend to forget / decide my hot mess morning look takes precedent to eating breakfast prior to leaving for work.
Sometimes a girl just wants some Matzoh Ball soup and this place is one of my faves...
