Whether you like a hot pastrami on rye or a plain ol' turkey sandwich this deli is the real deal!

name: Gaby Et Jules
highlights: Obviously, being that it was my first macaron experience, I have nothing to compare these beauties to.
Earl Grey, White Chocolate Basil, and that one with apricot are my go-to favorites, but you really can't go wrong no matter what you choose.
Some of the favorites among those I tried were the Earl Grey, lavender, and the rose.

name: I Tea Cafe
highlights: I really enjoyed coming here, it located near walnut st which meant parking was difficult.
Okay, it is a bit off the beaten path, a few blocks down from Walnut Street.
There is a $15 minimum to use a credit card which I didn't know prior to sitting down.

name: Corner Mercantile
highlights: Gluten free, vegan, carnivores and paleo folks.
The had a vegan mole meatball sandwich was was very flavorful on some soft and crusty bread - yum!
I'd definitely recommend the Corner Mercantile to anyone looking for a quick lunch, or even looking for somewhere to linger a little longer.

name: P&G’s Pamela’s Diner
highlights: The staff is friendly and it's great for brunch.
My mom ordered the strawberry hotcakes and I forget what my dad ordered, but they enjoyed theirs very much, as well.
The hot cakes are a must, and if you're looking for a really good time, croissant French toast will rock your tastebuds.

name: Grand View Buffet
highlights: Corporate entity or not, the Sunday Brunch Buffet is one to go out of your way for if you live or are visiting in Pittsburgh.
The price is very reasonable and I recommend the Sunday brunch which is $19.99 and includes all you can drink bloody Marys or mimosas.
OMG, everything in the dessert section is so tasty, I got way too much desserts.

name: Thai Place Restaurant
highlights: Bumping up my stars because I have recently found out that they use a soy sauce in their sauces that is gluten free!
Different than most versions I've had but it was absolutely fantastic.
The Tom kha soup with vegetables is delicious and so is the butternut squash curry.

name: Il Tetto:  A Rooftop Beer Garden
highlights: The crowd is great and it's really good for office happy hours.
I cannot wait to visit again especially in the summer when the roof is open.
The hostess directed us to the elevator which is in the exact opposite corner of the restaurant as the one that you enter from.

name: Mike & Tony’s Gyros
highlights: Parking is tricky and tight at both locations, so be careful.
If you must have mystery meat snack after a night of over imbibing in South Side, make the stop at Mike & Tony's.  Add some fries.
Now, keep in mind this is based on one visit, Gyro to Gyro.

name: Pickles Pizza & Sandwich Emporium
highlights: I remember getting the large pepperoni pizza every weekend that I spent in the North Side.
There is some  seating, but there are often locals hanging around, so if that's not your scene, just pick up to go or request delivery.
I, too, stumbled upon this place while visiting a relative who was at Allegheny General, and I've subsequently visited her before/after Pirate games.

name: Park Pizza & Cream
highlights: The amount of cheese put on the pizza was more than enough and really filled me up.
My boyfriend and I live about a 10 minute walk away, making it SO easy to get a pie to go when we don't feel like cooking.
We couldn't help but notice the wide variety of ice cream flavors available, as well as the lemon water ice, so we will surely be back to try them out.

name: Bar Louie
highlights: Happy hour includes half price appetizers, $3 for all draft beers, $4 for all wines, and $5 for all mixers.
I always get the Voodoo Chicken sandwich with tater tots ('cause it's awesome).
The terrace was full, so we asked if we could occupy the vacant private room right near the hostess stand.

name: Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen
highlights: The same holds true with Molly's. A scan of our local Pennysaver tabloid turned up no new pizza restaurants that would come to Beechview.
Well done Ephesus, you set the bar for all other local delivery spots to try to live up to!
I did try a slice of the sojcuk pide, however, which is topped with cheese and Turkish pepperoni.

name: Great Harvest Bread Co
highlights: This is our weekly bread shop - we always get a loaf of the Dakota, but we also love the Breakfast Blast, cinnamon Raisin and honey whole wheat loaves.
Great Harvest is warm and welcoming, and I don't think you will find a better loaf of handmade bread anywhere.
Anyway, this place is tucked in the same shopping center as Trader Joe's and behind the McDonald's, so its a little hidden.

name: China Wok
highlights: The Wok is a great lunch option for a typical weekday, but I wouldn't take a girl here to impress her.
We came here prior to watching WWE Monday Night Raw live at the Consol Energy Center, and I didn't find it lousy at all.
My top recommendation here would be the szechuan beef noodle soup.

name: Peppi’s
highlights: The steak sandwich, chicken, burgers, salads are all good.
A must along with Primanti's if you are visiting the steel city as a sandwich lover
The Downtown location gave me a free portion of fries because I had to wait about 30 seconds longer than they said I would have to wait.

name: Barb’s Corner Kitchen
highlights: Great diner for an early breakfast or late brunch.
The dress code is anywhere from sweatpants to three piece suits and the regulars make it feel like home.
I ordered the veggie omelet, tomatoes, mushrooms and green peppers with egg whites only, wheat toast and hash browns/potatoes.

name: Dobra Tea
highlights: (Yes, they have free WiFi, just ask your server for the password.)
This is probably better for casually meeting up with someone than for sitting down for a study session.
The waiter also brings you a bell and you ring whenever you're ready or if you need anything during your visit.

name: Perlé
highlights: Bonus Perle's happy hours is from 5:00-8:00 pm!!!
The music picked up and the place was awesome for dancing, the crowd got more lively, and the drinks were reasonably priced!
Please note they enfoce a dress code (simple dress code) - no tennis shoes and prefer a shirt with a collar.

name: Feng Japanese Steak Hibachi & Sushi House
highlights: Awesome happy hour deals and the people were so nice!!
The laser lights, "dance floor," side rooms, and bridge with swimming fish gave them plenty to explore.
The outside of the building looks plain but the interior looks amazing.

name: Alexander’s Italian Bistro
highlights: I usually get the gluten-free pasta with peas, hot Italian sausage and the gorgonzola (I think) cream sauce.
In our leftover bag our waitress put in there an entire loaf of bread for free...talk about wonderful customer service!
On my second visit I enjoyed the "pastabilities" create your own pasta.

name: Eat’n Park Restaurant
highlights: They have gluten-free buns for all sandwiches and burgers for only 50 cents extra.

If it was not for the Big Boy and superburger there would not be a big Mac (invented in western PA in response to the BB and SB which does extremely well here when 15 cent mckyd's weren't hitting it .
Very nice new building with a drive up window.

name: DeMore’s Pizzeria
highlights: I have been eating pizza and steak hoagies here since high school (many moons ago).
Very happy with new owners, they really did what was necessary to revamp the place.

name: Andrew’s Steak and Seafood
highlights: located in the northshore inside the casino and most definately worth the price.
and finally main courses - 2 steaks with a trio of sides, ciopinno and the monkfish...
They are accompanied by Cocktail sauce, Mignonette, and Horseradish sauce.

name: Blue Dust
highlights: They have a really great happy hour where all beers on tap (and they always have a ton) are half off.
This place is just outside of the waterfront in Homestead - you'd drive right past and never stop in unless someone told you to.
the ambiance embodies the heart and soul of Pittsburgh while maintaining a classic drink menu with a distinct and delicious twist.

name: Burgatory
address:
1001 Fifth Ave
Consol Energy Center
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Veltre’s Pizza
highlights: Also, I'm vegetarian and my mother can't eat red sauce.
The calzones, sides, burgers, and salads, especially the steak salad, are all also very, very good - I've literally had every single item on the menu and never been disappointed !
Veltres is amazing - great pizza, great service, fast delivery.

name: Zeke’s Coffee
highlights: They also sell a few local favorites, like Gluten Free Goat (gluten free baked goods, dah!).
Friendly to all diets and diet restrictions, and their cold brew is INCREDIBLE.
Apple cider donuts dipped in awesome Zeke's coffee = magic.

name: Pino’s Contemporary Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar
highlights: We'll definitely be back for brunch.
We were immediately greeted by Jen, one of the co-owners, as we entered.
I really one to come back int the summer when the front windows are opened and enjoy some wine and small dishesa

name: Frankie’s Extra Long
highlights: Myself and Eleven co-workers stopped this afternoon and ordered 12 Hot Sausages.
The meatballs are made in a crock pot, so they're wonderfully soft, just like the bread.
This is definitely a hot dog joint that's been around for a while and has resisted change it's entire life.

name: Buckhead Saloon
highlights: The weekend started with the STARQUEST filming, which led to an entertaining happy hour.!!
We also received finger foods (meatballs, cheese sticks, pepperoni rolls, chicken fingers and cookies).
Just understand that you're probably going to run into a lot of youngsters (early 20s) and basics doing shots and celebrating birthdays too.
address:
225 W Station Sq Dr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Rose Tea Cafe
highlights: I am a vegan and I absolutely love their eggplant dishes.
I had the fried chicken which was perfectly crispy and flavorful and my boyfriend said the same about his porkchops.
Also note there's no way to find a seat at meal time, so be prepared to order meal to go or wait for 15 minutes in a tiny space with a bunch of people.

name: That’s Amore
highlights: They also have a selection of soft drinks and a surprisingly full menu of salads, sides and entrees along with the pizza and sub menu.
Best delivery in Lawrenceville hands down!

name: Blue Sparrow Food Truck
highlights: Reasonable prices and quality grub.
$8 each and a good amount or pork and chicken on each respective sandwich, so I didn't leave hungry.
We opted for two tacos as pre-dinner appetizers.

name: Tenders Pittsburgh
highlights: I had quite the lunch adventure today and this was where it ended.
The breading was on the spicy side but was really, really, really, good.
The hot buffalo sauce is pretty darn good, and it's about the closest thing to my hometown's version of hot wings, which I had missed a lot.

name: Millvale Diner
highlights: And the home fries are to die for - I can't wait to go back for breakfast again!
It was pretty empty, but worried me at first, but Pamela's has a big name and a lot of locations throughout the city, so it's easier for them to draw a crowd.
The Greek omelet was flavorful, filling and satisfying.

name: Uncle Sam’s Submarines
highlights: I am a vegetarian and always find yummy things to eat
If you're anything like me...when you hit up Uncle Sam's ya just gotta go big or go home (or to the ATM since it's cash only!).
If subs aren't your thing the "Burgatory" and "Panera Bread" are next door.

name: Food For Thought Deli
highlights: Great lunch and breakfast sandwiches, and they have an interesting (in a good way) selection of bottled and canned drinks.
Basic deli meats are a 2-3$ dollars more expensive (likely higher quality)  than Giant Eagle but their specialty homemade items are worth trying.
I highly recommend because their coleslaw gives the sandwich a light sweetness.

name: Tai Pei
highlights: Lunch for 5 people:  4 lunch entrees with rice and soup and 1 sushi lunch (2 rolls) with soup, came to $57 which is an absolute deal in my book.
I frequently get delivery from here after work when I'm feeling lazy and their General Tso's and Ta-Chien chicken are the best!
The Tai pei is a big part of my childhood memories of growing up in Fox Chapel.

name: Prince of India
highlights: I get the garlic naan to accompany the buffet, it's the perfect vessel to sop up the spiced sauces and curries.
I've also tried out other curry but to me nothing taste better than chicken tikka masala.
I order through grub hub and you can add your spiciness preference.

name: Primanti Bros
address:
100 Art Rooney Ave
Heinz Field
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15212

name: Chateau Café & Cakery
highlights: They alway have a few gluten free baked goods daily, my favorite are the macaroons.
I live on the North Side so this is close and I kinda like that it's off the beaten path.
This is one of the hidden gem of the north sideline sure, and it's across the street from work.

name: la Cappella
highlights: Wings are solid too, I just prefer delivery over dine in any day of the week!
I make my own and am picky but the pasta was great.
I won't go anywhere else in the Waterworks area & we live within 5 miles.

name: Smokin’ Joe’s
highlights: Smokin joes is overall an awesome place to kick back, watch a game or go to happy hour and drink some awesome beers!
For Bar Food, Beer and Atmosphere - It is as good as it gets in PGH.
Food wise I have only ever had the fried pickles, wings and the rib wrap.

name: Hook Fish & Chicken
highlights: As far as chicken dinners they offer gizzards, nuggets, tenders and wings and they are also available in small and large sizes.
It is cash only and take out only with an ATM on site.
I would've liked a little more seasoning on my whiting, but nothing some hot sauce couldn't fix.

name: SLICE on Broadway
highlights: Top that off  with fresh mozzarella and fresh picked basil and you have a pizza that can't be beat.
The Fancy Pants is by far one of my all-time favorite ever.
The Slaughterhouse Five is topped with pepperoni, sausage, bacon, capicola and prosciutto -- I basically died and went to Italian heaven.

name: Chengdu Gourmet
highlights: Overall, I think that this restaurant has a lot of promise and much more variety than the Szechuan menus at How Lee and Sichuan Gourmet.
I have only had delivery, so I can't comment on the restaurant itself, but I have ordered from here several times and always received generous servings of good, fresh food.
We ordered from the Szechuan menu and had fish filet in spicy broth, dumplings in Szechuan sauce, double cooked pork belly and ox tongue and tripe.

name: Chan An Restaurant
highlights: I just wish they delivered and the place didn't look like such a dump.
When I got it back to the office I saw that they threw in 2 free egg rolls, a nice touch for an egg roll fan like me!
There are tables for dine-in eating, but I'd say more than 90% of Chan An's business is take out.
address:
37 Walsh Rd
Crafton Ingram Shopping Ctr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15205

name: Pleasure Bar and Restaurant
highlights: I have never called ahead for reservations and i have never had to wait for a table and I believe this is only bc I've got lucky every time I dine there.
The portions are a good size, and you might even have a very small portion of leftovers.
..stopped by for comedy sauce last night to get out of the house.

name: Nakama
highlights: They charge you for all of these little extra things too, like fried rice, which I feel is pretty unnecessary.
We sat near the Carson street side windows (great for people watching).
Very unique rolls and large portion size.

name: AJ’s Burger & Peruvian Rotisserie Chicken
highlights: You can get spaghetti or Russian salad or burritos or a single fried egg if that's what moves you.
I had the Pollo A Lo Pobre, a quarter chicken with 2 fried eggs (so you don't have to decide which came first).
In addition to visiting the restaurant I've used them several times for delivery and it can take awhile so be prepared.

name: Local Bar + Kitchen
highlights: The happy hour was held on the rooftop deck, which is now covered and has heaters for the wintertime.
We were greeted with water and Tim happily made us a delicious mimosa carafe.
My GF had the banana stuffed french toast and I think it changed my life it was so good.

name: Sharp Edge Beer Emporium
highlights: The cost is eased by their amazing happy hour, weekdays 4:30-6:30 when Belgians are half price and other drafts are a dollar off.
- You can order a hamburger with buffalo or ostrich meat.
Every night after 10pm, Sharp Edge has a late-night menu where many appetizers are half off, including large pizzas and some other times.
address:
302 S St Clair St
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15206

name: The Inn on Negley
highlights: The Inn on Negley also has a private parking lot in the back meant for their guests but street parking is plentiful around there, as well.
I recently hosted my friend's bridal shower here and everything was absolutely perfect!
The Victorian home is a bed and breakfast and the rooms are beautiful with privates bath.

name: Penn Brewery
highlights: I'm very happy I revisited Pittsburgh largest and oldest brewery, but slightly bummed I missed out on their $3 Happy Hour drafts.
Penn Weizen - We are all familiar with this style, the nice Bavarian wheat.
I'm a fan of their Penn Pilsner and a big big big fan of their special Chocolate Meltdown, which they debuted last Valentines Day.

name: Tong’s Cuisine
highlights: Fast service, cheap lunch prices.
This gem can be found in a super unimpressive box of a building in Oakland, which an interior as unadorned as the outside.
Ever since my first Szechuan experience as a freshman at Pitt, I've been on a seemingly infinite mission to find-and-dine every Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh.

name: Buon Giorno Cafe
highlights: Cute little restaurant just before the Smithfield Street Bridge makes for some fun sights to take in while having an enjoyable lunch.
Perfect balance of oil and vinegar and spices.
Their chai latte is amazing and so are there breakfast bagels and croissants.

name: Johnny’s Diner
highlights: After my GPS took me in circles a few times, I finally made it to Pip's - except now it's Johnny's.  I understand not much has changed.
If you are looking for a delicious, no-frills breakfast, this is the place.
I like that I can order grits, that's fairly unique for Pittsburgh.

name: Cafe Milano
highlights: with daily happy hour, pirates game specials and weekend deals its a no-brainer to knock back a few and try some food.
The other thing I love about Cafe Milano is they sell pizza on the sidwalk before Pirates games.
I stick with an 8" hoagie (which is considered their "half" hoagie) and it's always plenty to eat.

name: Orient Express
highlights: I enjoy Orient Express primarily for its large portions, cheap prices, and wide array of vegetarian options.
Though I wouldn't normally give this place 4 stars, I give it for 4 stars in relation to the other eateries right next to CMU(Craig St. Area).
Oh, and personally, I find OE's pearl milk tea (which comes hot, or cold) a lot better than LuLu's.

name: Dorothy 6 Blast Furnace Cafe
highlights: My husband and I got there before happy hour ended and ordered some pierogies and stuffed meatballs at a discounted HH price.
in a town such as Homestead, which has few shopping and dining options outside of the Waterfront.
When ordering at Dorothy 6, I saw that Brussel sprouts were serves as a side to most dishes.

name: All India
highlights: Besides buffet, I had also tried andhra spicy dosa from the menu, which was great too!
Every label listed whether the item was gluten free or vegan which was a good comfort.
We also got the All India Platter as an appetizer - chicken tikka, lamb kabab, samosa, fish amritsari, and vegetable pakora - and everything on it was marvelous.

name: Primanti Bros
address:
1001 Fifth Ave
Consol Energy Center
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Claddagh Irish Pub
highlights: I've been here a few times over the past few months for Happy Hour or a night for some drinks on the weekend.
If you live in the area or are staying in the area, you should stop by here, on a Tuesday and enjoy yourself and the Shepherd's Pie!
A Wonderful way to spend St Patrick's Day.

name: Jimmy John’s
highlights: I did find it a bit odd that all of there deli meats had gluten but better safe than sorry.
The vito is awesome and I love their totally tuna.
So far, the beach club is my favorite.

name: China Taste
highlights: My friend says the hot and sour soup here is the best she's tasted as well.
I really enjoy China Taste, and if they delivered I'd give them 5 stars.
The General Tso's chicken wasn't the best I've ever had but certainly wasn't bad at all.

name: Brillobox
highlights: Love the hipster vibe this joint has and apparently they have some good happy hour deals.
In SF, LA, or NY, it would be mocked for being faux-hipster, pretentious, superficial and for trying too hard.
The interior is decorated well and I remember admiring the wallpaper last time I was there.

name: Bigelow Grille
highlights: But dinner here is definitely not blue collar.
My favorite parts of the meal were the starting bread with this amazing chutney dip followed with spicy tomato bisque.
I had the fortune of enjoying all of my breakfasts for free with a coupon voucher given to my group as a compliment.

name: People’s Indian Restaurant
highlights: I especially recommend the lunch buffet for first timers who maybe don't know what they want, but are interested in trying Indian food.
I was babysitting one of my rental places and was craving Indian so I ordered through grub hub for delivery.
People's is one of the most authentic restaurants in the city for Indian cuisine.

name: Mullaneys Harp and Fiddle
highlights: My brother and I have spend many long nights at the bar and it's usually the first choice for work happy hours too.
Shepherds Pie, Fish and Chips, and some basic sandwiches, etc.  I got the Fish and Chips and I thought that they were pretty damn good.
This is the best Irish pub in the city; while Claddagh is a corporate chain (that isn't quite authentic), and Piper's Pub is a wonderful pub...

name: Lin’s Asian Fusion
highlights: I've ordered something different every time (always vegetarian), and every time I've been really happy with, and sometimes blown away by, the food.
One thing I can say about Lin's is that the food is always fresh and delivery is always fast.
The crab rangoons and the coconut chicken have become my favorite meals but I've liked every thing I've happened to try.

name: India on Wheels
highlights: Dish to try for a vegetarian like me would be paneer makhani or palak paneer.
One thing I don't like about this is that the spice level changes every time I eat here even though I ask for 7.
According to my senior colleague (who has been at Pitt for over 20 years), this is the best food truck at University of Pittsburgh.

name: Plum Pan Asian Kitchen
highlights: All-in-all, a nice place for a little happy hour.
For lunch I ordered octopus sushi a la carte, and Shrimp Pad Thai which I requested be prepared spicy at a level 8.
The Marilyn Mon Roll is spider roll meets decadence.

name: Say Cheese! Pizza
highlights: Let me start by saying I'm kind of a pizza savant and have tried a lot of pizza places around Pittsburgh.
Their prices are also very budget friendly, and they have free delivery!
I want to be in college again just so I could eat there.

name: Café Phipps
highlights: Don't be afraid to try something new--they get it right here--from quinoa pasta to vegan sandwiches.
This place is a hidden gem and you should eat here even if you aren't touring the conservatory.
For example, it's hard to find healthy options for children, however the Phipps has gotten rid of their high sugar drinks in favor of healthier options.

name: Starlite Lounge
highlights: Basically the entire menu is fabulous ...
I know this was on the Food Network and all, but it's not really a dive as places in this area go.
Ok, this place is my absolute favorite place to come and play bluegrass music on a Tuesday nite.

name: Sushi Kim Restaurant
highlights: Now that the weather has warmed up a bit, I don't mind venturing more than a few blocks from the office for lunch.
Yelp didn't exist when I used to go here, back in the CMU days, but it is still my favorite Soon Du Bu (Tofu Stew) place - we just LOVED it.
Although the presentation wasn't flawless, I thought the sashimi was fresh and delicious.

name: Namaste India
highlights: We almost always go for the lunch buffet and have eaten here at least 25-30 times now.
I love ordering takeout from Namaste
The chicken curry could have used more curry.

name: Bella Notte
highlights: While my family was bummed that we didn't get a "real brunch" since Delucca's and Pamela's were ridiculously long wait times, the awesomeness of this pizza (Mediterranean style).
We also tried their Bloody Mary, and were pleasantly intrigued by its salty olive-y flavor...
Deja-vu Time: I recently had myself an Italian "Stallion" hoagie from Greentree's Other Place.

name: Salonika Gyros
highlights: My vegan friend got the falafel and was impressed as well.
Some of the winning dishes are the baked chicken, chicken gyros, and definitely the lemon potatoes.
There is a menu on the board - gyros, salads, moussaka, etc.  I decided to follow my friend's lead and get the Zeus chicken - chicken, spinach and feta in phyllo with green beans in tomato sauce.

name: Joe’s Crab Shack
highlights: It's an all day happy hour that is totally worth it.
Like I said, get a bucket or steampot, don't cogitate over it, and make sure you can afford it.
We ordered 2 steampots, the crab nachos and the jumbo coconut shrimp.
address:
226 W Station Square Dr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Pgh Crepes
address:
Bigelow Blvd & Forbes Ave
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15213

name: China House
highlights: As someone who is constantly on the move between Shadyside and Bloomfield during the work week, I am always looking to find a quick, cheap lunch spot.
I've also had them cater some events and they've been very helpful, delivering huge portions of food, on-time and for a reasonable price.
This is the closest thing to getting Chinese food from D.C.  You definitely have to get the general tso's chicken.

name: Caffe Mona La Bistro
highlights: Nothing better with a tasty brunch than a good bottle of champagne, although their coffee was pretty darned delicious.
We had intended to visit J'eet today and found that it was gone, and Caffe Mona in its place.
My wife got the savory French toast with brie, fig preserves, and slices of granny smith apples on a thick piece of French toast.

name: Uncle Sam’s Submarines
highlights: My boyfriend and I eat here a lot on summer weekends especially, since parking and walking in Squirrel Hill is so gross during the winter.
If you eat at the restaurant you get free fries, but you will be filled just from the sandwich itself.
For two cheesesteaks, a ton of fries and one medium drink, it was under $20 for the two of us.

name: Options Food Court
address:
600 Forbes Ave Student Union
Ste 333
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Lydiah’s Coffee House
highlights: They offer a limited variety of dishes, yet there is always a vegan option on the menu - a little something for everyone!
the curry spaghetti is nothing special, but the ribs are amazing.
It is my understanding that the owner is Kenyan and she serves Kenyan food for lunch.

name: Cc’s Cafe
highlights: Entering the restaurant, the parking was limited, but lot was well kept (after a snow storm recently occurred in the city).
It is absolutely the best butternut squash ravioli I have ever tasted- highly recommend!
They were both served with homemade pasta and we were delighted when given the choice between linguine, angel hair, penne or pepper linguine.

name: Sola Pizza
highlights: It was like Sal's Pizza (large, crispy crust) but even bigger and with more flavor despite it being sauceless.
Delivery came earlier than estimated.

name: Wai Wai Chinese Cuisine
highlights: They have these fantastic "Lunch Boxes" that are very reasonable and have a ton of food in them.
The food here is amazing, whether you're eating in our getting takeout or delivery.
First time getting takeout there, egg rolls were not great but meal (seafood delight and chicken in bean sauce) were good.

name: Antoon’s Pizza
highlights: The dough isnt super gluten-y, its got a good crunch to it but still soft and fluffy on the inside.
If you want some extra attention to your pizza get a topping or the garlic crust and it comes out even better for just a little bit more!
Offering a $6 dollar pie in just minutes, Antoon's pizza is Pitt's superior late night za.

name: Hello Bistro
highlights: They have a variety of burgers if you're feeling indulgent or many different salad options if you are feeling like being a little healthier.
I got the citrus lime vinaigrette which was refreshing and went perfectly on top of a salad on a hot day.
Although the lines can get long during the lunch rush, the employees keep everyone moving at a very good pace.

name: Living Juicy
highlights: Although it is a vegan salad it is incredibly filling to me (a non-vegan).
Had the cold pressed Love and Beets beverage (beets, beet greens, pineapple, green apple) and it's a 10/10.
I picked out My Fave, which is a raw smoothie consisting of kale, coconut meat, coconut water, banana, mango, strawberry, maca root, and sea salt.

name: Crystal On Penn
highlights: Felafel platter - I ordered the vegetarian felafel platter with the rice and french fries.
Will have to stop back and have try the hummus, tabouli and kibbee, saw it on another table and it looked so good.
We used to go here before every Pens game when we had Season Tickets and then walk to the arena.

name: Alfred’s Deli & Market
highlights: They also have treats for our dog; vegan-friendly items; a limited assortment of fresh produce; and staples like milk and orange juice.
There are homemade Pierogies and cheeses and lunch meats.
I order an Italian sandwich pretty much everywhere I go since that's what I'm most interested in and this sandwich was great!

name: Coriander India Grill
highlights: If you cant decide what you want from the menu, getting the buffet allows you to try out about 15 different items.
My favorite chicken dishes are: Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Korma, Chicken Makhni/butter chicken, Chicken Saag, and Chicken Curry.
Try the dishes from the a la carte menu if you want some tasty food.

name: Yuva India Kitchen + Bar
highlights: I had the maseladar lunch which consisted of butter chicken , butter nan, salad and basmati rice.
I discovered Yuva Indian with a friend who had never before tried such flavorful cuisine - I would say this is a great eatery for someone new to Indian - very round flavors and sauces.
It is probably pricier than the other Pittsburgh Indian joints.

name: Little Asia
highlights: An odd location but the lunch was quite delicious with large and perfectly cooked veggies and meat, service was quick and my lunch was a mere $6.
A short distance from CMU and U Pitt, this restaurant is a good place to go for inexpensive Chinese food.
I would pick Little Asia over Lulu's Noodles or Oriental Express anytime.

name: Caliente Pizza & Draft House
highlights: They have one of the best happy hours in Pittsburgh: half off craft drafts and $5 one-topping personal pizzas from 4:30-630pm weekdays.
Deliver is through GrubHub, so a fee does apply (this fee varies on the place you order from, from what I have noticed).
The menus are takeout menus - what?

name: New Dumpling And Sushi House
highlights: I also recommend the veggie "chicken" with vegetables and the vegetarian paradise, as well as the veggie lo mein or fried rice.
This isn't "the best ______ I ever had" kind of a restaurant but your solid, go-to delivery/take out/dine-in solution.
Portion sizes are decent--my boyfriend and I can split an appetizer and entree and be satisfied.

name: Honest John’s Bar & Restaurant
highlights: The owner, "Honest John" was there to chat with us     I'm looking forward to returning to try more on the menu and see the happy hour specials.
I had the brussels sprouts and short rib quesadilla which was spectacular!
They did a great job with the décor, which is a modern rustic theme.

name: Eighth & Hays
highlights: I would recommend for a happy hour spot or just to grab drinks.
The charcuterie board was expansive with a variety of hams, sausages and cheeses, accompanied by 3 different spreads along with Pitas and toast.
For dessert, if you like ice cream and milkshakes, you MUST try their "Love Jugs."

name: Patron Mexican Grill
highlights: The only Mexican place in the Pittsburgh area that has a section of the menu just for vegetarians!
We went to Mad Mex as our 1st mexican experience in PBurgh and it was NASTY so we were pleasantly surprised to find this little gem just a few steps away.
I've now tried the chimichanga, the enchiladas, and the chicken fajitas - all excellent, though probably not so excellent for my waistline.

name: Burgatory
highlights: the onion rings are almost as big as the burgers, found this out with coworkers who went for happy hour with half priced apps!
I had the Nutella Shake and my niece had the Caramel Pretzel shake.
Great food and great service :) Burgatory is my favorite burger place in Pittsburgh :)

name: Bartram House Bakery & Cafe
highlights: The location is convenient in my opinion because it's far enough from the bars so that you have metered street parking in the area.
Ok wasn't really planning on stopping here but walked by and saw someone with a breakfast sandwich that looked amazing and decided I wanted one too.
I've had a few of their salads, my favorite being the Mediterranean Salmon salad, and the Filet.

name: Mario’s South Side Saloon
highlights: I give it 5 stars for being a great local bar with a great staff for happy hour or a couple drinks on a weeknight.
Mario's is smoke-free and Blue Lou's is smoker friendly, so take your pick.
Between the tater tots (hello) , fried pickles and my all-time-favorite, the Golden Gate Turkey, you can't go wrong with your pick.

name: Gran Canal Caffe
highlights: Parking available behind the restaurant and very very limited street parking.
As we were the last ones to leave last night, we spent some time meeting and talking with Antoinette, Michael and family.
Hopefully next time I'm in Pittsburgh I can have the pleasure of eating there again.

name: Indian Spices
highlights: Other favorites from the buffet:  chicken tari, chicken saag, aloo gobhi, channa masala, and gulab jamun.
If you haven't tried their coconut soup, it's rather unique and delicious.
I went here with a few friends right after watching a Pirates game at PNC Park.

name: Bob’s Sub
highlights: They have a good selection, I personally go for the Spicy Italian which has a generous amount of meat and toppings on a Cellone's roll.
All the subs are on toasted Cellone's rolls, with lettuce, provolone, onion, tomato, mayo, and Italian dressing and some sort of miracle happens.
If you go at lunchtime you can get a combo with a "freshman" sub, side (chips, macaroni salad or pickle spears) and a soda for $5.50!!!

name: O’Leary’s
highlights: It is the standard Carson Street quandry: finding that coveted parking space on the main drag or on one of the side streets.
I had an awesome breakfast, friendly service, cash only so heads up you hipsters.
Their hot sausage patty is the best around ; and they actually take the time to nicely brown their home-fry potatoes.

name: Kelly O’s Diner
highlights: Despite being very busy during the typical brunch rush (as all diners are), they do a really great job of moving things quickly--from seating to ordering to serving your order.
I also got a side of shredded potatoes as they are called on the menu, and requested they be covered in cheese.
Used to the 45+ minute waits at Pamelas and Delucas, we were unsure whether or not we should stay, but we got through so fast.

name: Steel Cactus
highlights: Drinks: We stopped in quick, no time to drink b/c work, but I am dying to try their nice margarita menu...good happy hour specials.
The queso was the best out of the dips and the taquitos were also very good.
Brunch has a Bloody Mary bar with so many topping and their Bloody Mary mix is delicious.

name: Sammy’s Famous Corned Beef
highlights: Sides include macaroni salad, potato salad and cole slaw-- all of which I have eaten and enjoyed.
The potatoe salad is nothing special but it completes the meal.
I had the "famous special" (just its name) with Corned beef & sauerkraut on rye.

name: Steel Cactus
highlights: Really good happy hour specials, I am doing low carb and the really nice bartender helped me pick a delicious grilled chicken salad.
Shadyshade seems pretty gentrified to me with it's Apple Store and Microsoft Store, but then again, there's nothing fru-fru about a Yinzerita and a 412 Burrito.
She was very helpful and accommodating, and squeezed us in on the rooftop even though there were already parties booked.

name: Conicella Pizza
highlights: Having tried every pizza in a 10 mile radius we decided to give this place a shot.
They also have all the old Pepsi signage relics from the 80s. Delivery is always on time and reliable, cash only
We had their $18 special - large 16" cheese (we added X-cheese and sausage for $3), whole Italian hoagie, and 2-liter pop.

name: Hello Bistro
highlights: Recently found out they do breakfast/brunch as well but have not yet tried it.
I also had the burgers which are decent and the chili which is hearty and they offer boylan soda which is greatttt.
I also ordered fries on the side which came in a brown paper bag - super neat.

name: Redbeard’s On Sixth
highlights: To top it off, we frequented during happy hour so 3.00 domestic drafts among other well drink/wine specials.
Headed to "The Burg" for a Pirates game and city tour.
The sweet potato waffle fries rounded out a delightful bar meal and our service was overall good.

name: Las Velas
highlights: I had went here for a happy hour months before the horrible Market Square construction had from my understanding shut Las Velas down.
Queso was amazing as always, gauc was fresh with huge chunks of avocado and salsa was mild and refreshing.
Everything I've ever had on the menu has been great (lunch combo, mahi mahi tacos, burritos, enchiladas).

name: Lombardozzi’s Restaurant
highlights: The best luck that I've had with parking is a block away in the lot next to Immaculate Conception Church.
This is old school italian in the best way possible.
Today we had a small banquet, of about 30 people, for lunch to celebrate a mile stone.

name: Wiener World
highlights: A good tasting dog, with natural casing that snaps when you bite into it, that is grilled with they have the usual condiments.
All beef, natural casing, or kielbasi ...
I miss working downtown, because I used to visit this place a good bit when the weather was warm.

name: Lesvos Gyros
highlights: Street parking at lunch is easy; at any other time, not so much.
Let me preface; I am well aware that Mike & Tony's is a Pittsburgh legend when it comes to gyros.
Only knocked a star because they're cash only.

name: Sushi Too
highlights: I usually go to the area for a light lunch and shopping, and luckily sushi too is great for a light lunch.
We usually get a Sushi/Tempura combination with Miso soup and ginger dressing on our salad.
PS: Did you know, they are also owned by the same people who own China Palace a few doors down?

name: Emil’s Lounge
highlights: Parking is plentiful and seating is too.
Cannot beat their fish sandwiches (although I do miss the buns as opposed to the sliced bread...stop that).
Emil's was featured on 25 things I love about Pittsburgh last year and have been meaning to come through and check it out.

name: Sushi Boat
highlights: I tend to stick with vegetarian sushi rolls so I can't comment on the quality/freshness of the seafood.
The seating area upstairs is kind of bare and small, but still comfortable and always clean.
Sushi Fuku next door has always been the more welcoming restaurant in terms of appearance, but now that I've tried Sushi Boat, I think I will probably be going to the latter way more.

name: Kelly’s Bar & Lounge
highlights: Every night there is a different cocktail special for $4 all night and the happy hour from 5-7 let's you get appetizers for half off.
The crowd varies from hipsters to students to older professionals to locals.
My favorite things are the Mac and cheese (to die for), sweet potato fries, and their super tasty sidecar.

name: Forbes Gyro
highlights: I will definitely add this place to my lunch repertoire.
I'm not a gyro fan, but I do like falafel and hummus so the next time I will probably go that route.
We also had the cigars (4 in the container) so good,  sooooo good.

name: The Big Idea Bookstore and Cafe
highlights: They have everything from gender politics to vegan cookbooks to fiction, zines and more!
Prob not the best place to sit for a prolonged time for free wifi with your laptop.
As for the cafe portion of the shop, I love their tea selections, and all of their food is made from local, organic, seasonal, fair trade, and/or sustainable sourced ingredients.

name: Wings Over  - Pittsburgh
highlights: I love that everyone who is writing reviews for this place remember fondly former times at other Wings Over locations.
We tried: cajun teriyaki, hot garlic, afterburner (super spicy buffalo), citrus chipotle and mustang ranch.
The Jet Fuel had a very unique spicy flavor which I liked, and they had some SERIOUS kick.

name: Cavo Nightclub
highlights: The salad was absolutely mouth watering with an array of cheese nuts berries accompanying the steak and lettuce- it knocked my socks off.
I love how dedicated Cavo is to its theme from the art on the walls to the go girls dancing in the window above the dance floor.
The boyf's burger was AWESOME- there was a TON of bacon, which I loved (I snuck a couple bites in) and it was cooked wonderfully.

name: Hambone’s Neighborhood Bar and Grill
highlights: Also, they have a great happy hour, and if you live in the East End you should definitely stop in on your way home from downtown.
A great dive/diner vibe, always good live music, great beer, great people.
If you are around on a Thursday night, you must stop in for comedy open-mic night.

name: Milky Way
highlights: To summarize: reasonably priced for kosher pizza, large servings, free refills on drinks in a fast, friendly, and clean place.
If you're looking for vegetarian-friendly comfort food or a good salad, then this is the place to go.
Great for people who keep kosher or are vegetarians.

name: Fu Lai Chinese Restaurant
highlights: It turns out they offer a number of different soups with different contents, some spicy and others not, and mostly for around $7.
Living down here it's been wonderful having the ability to have things delivered other than pizza.
If your idea of Chinese food is Orange Chicken and General Tzo's -- this is probably not your restaurant, although I encourage you to be adventurous.

name: Archie’s
highlights: Which was fair, but I wish I could've gotten 5 wings in one flavor and 5 in another because it all looked so good!
My favorite location for Monday night football and Thursday night football.
If you want to see teams other than the Steelers on the NFL Sunday ticket and want a place that is always open all day on Sundays, Archies is your place.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
highlights: It is hard to find parking near by which can add 20 mins to your lunch, easily.
If you'd like to keep the meal healthier, I would skip the sour cream, cheese and burrito wrap and pick a burrito bowl.
Lately, I'm addicted to the veggie salad with fajita veggies and guacamole.

name: Arby’s
highlights: I love the curly fries and the chicken sandwich is the best of all of the fast food restaurants.
I ordered a roast beef slider, vanilla milkshake, small fry, and slated caramel cookie.

name: Joe’s Doghouse
address:
Corner Of Tech St And Margaret Morrison St
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15217

name: BRAVO! Cucina Italiana
highlights: Not only do they have 5 dollar drink specials but they have 4 dollar happy hour plates which are DELICIOUS and quite large for portion size.
We have this restaurant always as our favorite place to go when we are in the waterfront.
I most frequently order the Pasta Woozie.
address:
250 W Bridge St
West Homestead
, 
PA
 
15120

name: Rialto Pizza
highlights: Strange parking for a flat lander (had to circle around and try again).
I get their xtra large cheese pizza delivered to my work all the time.
But any place you can get a pierogi pizza and six pack of Four Loko on a Sunday gets my approval.

name: The Mintt
highlights: This buffet goes beyond the typical chicken tikka masala, Chana masala etc and gives you lots of non typical buffet items.
Several spicy dishes were ordered at a spice level of 7, and I felt that they got the right amount of heat.
I was eager to try it out, as rumor is the restaurant is owned by the former head chef at Tamarind.

name: 61C Cafe
highlights: Metered parking is available nearby, but you might find some free spots farther out in the neighborhoods.Or just hop on the 61C bus - it will drop you off right in front of the shop!
Cash only here my friends - but reasonably priced coffee and lattes and fancy little pastries and snacks.
Most complaints here seem centered on lack of outlets and uncomfy chairs or bad chai lattes.

name: Italian Village Pizza
highlights: Numerous TVs to watch while you eat, this would be a cool place to take in a game while having some of the best pizza we've had in Pittsburgh so far.
One of the good places for lunch at waterworks.
Made with real fresh ingredients and delivered hot.

name: Wheel House
highlights: I enjoyed a great burger, fries and 3 beers during happy hour for around $30 and was very pleased.
Their waffle fries are TO DIE for - probably my favorite in the city!
The beer battered onion rings were good and the nachos were huge and the peppers not too hot.

name: Studio AM
highlights: If you think that you know the coolest brunch spot in Pittsburgh and haven't been to Studio Am, you should re-evaluate how cool you are.
The place is brilliantly decorated with Baron Batch's colorful pop art and John Malecki's furniture so my eyes never stopped wandering around while I was eating.
The creator, artist and owner has created a really urban hangout featuring his work and some of the BEST FOOD from Chef Steve.

name: The Pizza Company
highlights: Fortunately, Pizza Company knows how to make real pizza--NY style.
The small is a decent price $5.99 for cheese and has six slices.
Great lunch special for two slices and a drink for $5.99.

name: Mitchell’s Restaurant Bar & Banquet Center
highlights: The bar area is non-smoking during the day (great for business lunch or happy hour ) but becomes smoker friendly later in the evening.
and I definitely picked the RIGHT choice (she was not much of a hockey fan) but we would have stopped in there in any case since the parking is free after 6 and its close to Consol.
On the day of our event the food was delicious, the drinks were great, and Gina was there to make sure everything ran smoothly.

name: The Simple Greek
highlights: Although I have to pass on the gyro meat, they do not fall short on their vegetarian options.
I've had both the pita and the salad before, they offer different meats and proteins and then your choice of mix-ins.
They had an enormous variety of topics, well beyond the basics--3 choices of cucumber/tomato mixes and grape leaves for good measure.

name: Primanti Bros.
highlights: This place happy hour is amazing!!
This place had great food, I dont typically like coleslaw but theirs was almost like a sauerkraut so I really enjoyed it!
The sandwich is a little light on meat, but the piles of fries and slaw really make for a beautiful pile of awesome.

name: Rock Bottom
highlights: I wish that they had asked us if we wanted to sit in the bar since happy hour was still going, but that isn't a big thing.
Overall I definitely recommend eating here if you're in the Waterfront!
I go back to Pittsburgh often and Rock Bottom ends up being a good standby for a dinner and a movie kind of night.

name: Wheelhouse
highlights: The wheelhouse offers a nice happy hour until 7pm with some good apps at half price definitely made for sharing!
I got pierogi nachos(pierogis in cheese sauce, tomatoes, red onion, sour cream and chives).
Great food and service for a reasonable price.

name: Duke’s Upper Deck Cafe
highlights: Soups of the days are awesome (Potato soup yes please) and they have a excellent happy hour special that will save you a few dollars.
On my most recent visit, I dined here for lunch with my parents and my mom and I both gave into the "favorite" on the menu, "The Pinkerton".
Fortunately, the bar is close enough to the waterfront that it's just far enough out of the ghetto...the crowd is certainly decent.

name: Ephesus Pizza
highlights: The drawback to pick up is trying to find parking along a busy Lincoln Ave, but the food is well worth the minor inconvenience.
Mixed Grill Platter - 5/5 - Seriously, the fact that I can get this delivered to my house makes me swoon a little.
This is my new go-to place for chicken gyros.

name: Hard Rock Cafe
highlights: I had the vegetarian burger, which can equipped with portobello mushroom, a huge grilled red pepper as well as some other grilled veggies.
I love sitting outside, looking out on the river, the city and the dancing fountain.
He even gave a great recommendation on The Big Texan sandwich with pulled pork ( I was there for a burger).
address:
230 W Station Sq Dr
Pittsburgh
, 
PA
 
15219

name: Everyday’s A Sundae
highlights: The parking situation kind of sucks because it's along that main strip where there's construction and turning lanes.
Chose red velvet and wow moist not stale and sitting out for days- very satisfying.
It came with a side of potato chips (or you can choose potato salad), and drink (I chose coffee) for under $9.

name: Beehive Coffee
highlights: Five stars for variety and vegan options!
And yes, sometimes I miss people gathering to camp out to play games in the side rooms or buying art work from an old cigarettes vending machine.
Drinks came up in funky mugs and mini mason jars and the people watching was superb.

name: India Palace Cuisine
highlights: There is always an excellent buffet for lunch with a wide array of both vegetarian and non-veg entrees (typically chicken for the non-veg).
i've had other dishes at india palace & aloo gobi is the best - it's OUT OF THIS WORLD & i can't recommend this dish enough !!!!!!!!
Although the tandoori chicken was a tad bit dry (and I'm nit-picking here), I can honestly say that there was nothing that I didn't like.

name: Alexion’s Bar & Grill
highlights: UPDATE: They feature a happy hour Monday through Friday from 5 to 7 and even on Saturday from 8 till 10!
I'll definately try one next time but it will be hard not to get that Reuben again.
They also have a nice selection of craft beers

name: Siam Thai Restaurant
highlights: The Pad Thai had a delicious reddish sauce that wasn't too sweet, and the chicken and vegetables were all up to par.
They have hot oil and thai hot pepper flakes on the table to add yourself and the oil is delicious.
It had quite the kick so be cautious around your spice scale when ordering.

name: Jimmy John’s
highlights: tuna sandwich is my favorite, best breakfast ever!!!
My favorite sub is the Club Lulu, which has turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on French bread.
It's all about the bread and if you go in grab a 50 cent day old loaf for the road.

name: Szechuan Express
highlights: My favorite is the Taiwanese Crispy Fish.
I go back every time I'm in Oakland, and I get the tofu and broccoli with garlic sauce, and I am content.
It's cheap and the portions are huge, so as a college student, it fills all of my expectations.

name: Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant
highlights: One tip- we never order sides (usually just pizza, entres, and salads) because there is so much to fill up on in terms of dishes.
Parking is available in a pay-per-hour garage.
Spaghetti With Meatballs-You almost don't need the pasta as their meatballs are garlic-packed asteroids of rich meatiness.

name: Food Shoppe
highlights: Cold Prepared Foods:  Lots of cold "salads" to choose from (i.e. Ham Salad, Chicken Salad, etc.).
After being out of town for two weeks, it was sure good to come back to Ruggeri's and sink my teeth into one of their fabulous grinders.
I was wowed with the selection at a tiny neighborhood deli and butcher shop that also sells convenience store and grocery items!

name: Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant
highlights: This is my favorite happy hour spot.
Remind me how good your hoagies are, that they're not overpriced like the Pizza is, and then serve me endless glasses of Coke Zero.
Full disclosure: while the wait staff is so friendly, they do get overwhelmingly busy at lunch.

name: Nico’s Recovery Room
highlights: A reading group that I am in frequently meets here around happy hour, and there are always plenty of tables and we can talk easily without having to yell.
The karaoke crowd is pretty diverse and if you are really lucky you may catch Abba singing the Dawson's Creek theme song.
This is a friendly, hipsters-and-yinzers-living-in-harmony kind of joint.

name: Old School Italian Sandwich Shop
highlights: The shop is located behind a credit union and there is plenty of close street parking on 9th.
The location is odd for first timers--it's technically in between the bank and the church.
Don't let the location keep you from stopping here - either to grab a bite for lunch or to take dinner home for your family.

name: Napoli Pizzeria
highlights: I love how thin the crust is and how cheesy the pizza is and how mild the sauce is.
All in all, even tho I am a big fan of Mineo's, I would and will definitely give these guys more business.
This place is a win win that locals truly appreciate, many of us have been going for years and years.

name: Delanie’s Coffee
highlights: As a vegan, I was also so impressed to know they  offer many organic, all natural selections as well.
Breakfast sandwiches (made from an actual cracked egg) are made-to-order and incredible.
The ambiance is very appropriate for a coffee shop, with art from local artists hanging on walls of exposed brick.

name: Nied’s Hotel
highlights: You can come in at 7 a.m. and get a beer and a breakfast.
I cannot believe that I have lived in Lawrenceville for as long as I have and have just recently started going to Nied's. This business loves live music!
Everyone ordered the fish sandwich at our table and we were not let down.

name: Peppi’s
highlights: Peppi's is a Pittsburgh institution that unlike Primanti's hasn't sold out yet.
I had a New Yorker which is basically a cheesesteak with bacon.
The Strip District folks asked for a signed CD and gave me a free Roethlisburger in return.

name: Pizza Italia
highlights: It's definitely a traditional New York-style pizza kind of place (in other words, no crazy/awesome combinations or vegan options - sorry).
Just a good straight forward mom and pop pizza pie.
Super cheap prices and ready quickly.

name: Angelo’s Pizzeria
highlights: Anyway, it took all my willpower not to have a pizza eating contest with myself right then and there.
Nothing lay between those Italian bread slices but steak, Italian dressing, onions that looked seasoned, peppered, lettuce, and tomato.
Sicilian Cuts and Cheese Fries are my go to every time I dine here!

name: Pizza Palermo
highlights: This is my favorite local pizza store in Pgh that delivers!
Great prices, late night hours, lightning fast delivery, and surprising quality.
Basically everything Italian on the menu that I've tried has been great but their wings could use some work.

name: Christos Mediterranean Grille
highlights: I swore when we arrived, I was entirely full from brunch but managed to wolf down half of my shared slice anyway.
I had navy bean soup, hummus, and something called Greek shepherds pie - roasted lamb chunks, peppers, brown sauce, in phyllo dough.
My favorite dishes are Tiropita, Christos chicken, the potatoes and the Jackie O cake.

name: Orient Kitchen
highlights: Get the salted-squid, and stir-fried chinese brocilli, the razor clams, the seafood soup, etc. I basically ask for whatever popular dishes the chinese customers eat.
Chicken in garlic sauce- I don't recall the name of the dish exactly but this on was fabulous!
I do agree that the price might be a bit high for some, but with the quality and quantity of their foods, especially here in Pgh, it's pretty darn yummy so we don't mind!

name: Noodles & Company
highlights: The place is always packed during lunch, for great reasoning, their food is amazing even during the lunch rush, they never drop the ball.
I tried it for the first time yesterday and ordered the Buff Japanese Pan w Marinated Steak.
I had Indonesian Peanut Sauté with chicken.

name: DiBella’s Subs
highlights: DiBella's not only offers subs but, salads, macaroni, potato and pasta salads, deli pickles and cookies as well.
I liked all their options but if you're a vegetarian they don't offer a huge selection.
This is by far my favorite sub place in Pittsburgh.

name: Sakura Teppanyaki & Sushi
highlights: I went to Sakura yesterday for lunch and I really enjoyed it!
This restaurant has some really decent north west Chinese food like 羊肉泡馍(pancake lamb soup), 肉夹馍(BBQ pork sandwich), 酸菜肥牛( pickle cabbage with beef).
The owners originally came from Ningxia, China.

name: Cherries Diner
highlights: The pro move is to eat this around 11 am to satisfy breakfast and lunch needs.
My Kitchen Sink omelette hit the spot-- all so good, filled with meat, veggie, potato perfection with touch of cheese!!
I would recommend the early bird special it's eggs meat potatoes  and a choice of 1 pancake or toast all around 7 dollars you can't go wrong!!!

name: Mendoza Express
highlights: I think you can also get that in a burrito, but I like the version that resembles scrambled eggs.
The al pastor taco is also very, very delicious and I have never had anything like it before.
It's an excellent option if you want take out on a Friday night and I think it's also a BYOB.

name: China Star
highlights: The lunch combos are great for the price and even the entrees aren't that expensive.
The food always tasty and arrives well before the estimated delivery time.
Used to be Yen's...we love this place.

name: Ichiban Hibachi Steak House and Sushi Bar
highlights: For lunch you can order soup, salad and two rolls for around eight dollars, and for the same lunch plus an additional roll you'll be paying around eleven dollars.
The filet was not as tender as I would have hoped - I'm not sure they are using the best grade of beef.
Service is usually great, they are quick and friendly, they take reservations and have private party rooms, the bar is fully stocked and serve amazing cool drinks.

983 Freeport Rd
Waterworks Mall

name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant
highlights: Watching my calories like crazy and I couldn't be happier to have the Olive Garden accommodate my low calorie lunch!
Once I add in those, it's more like I'm ruining my calorie count for the week at worst.
The chicken scampi is absolutely delicious as well as the chicken Alfredo.
